content.content: []>narrator:You reach your stop. No one else gets out. Desolate winds belt across of the city outskirts. The bus departs.<mp> In the distance, across the river shoreline, you can see the facsimile of life. Bored laborers in deadend jobs that grind up more people than they do material in the factories and commercial districts over yonder. <mp>Your eyes and skin burn from the bright daylight. <mp>Time to walk two more miles until you get home.<lc> You cross the bridge connecting the sterile offices with the rest of the world. Through unremarkable residential districts under a faded and grey sky, it is only the lifeless political suiters roaming the streets this time of year that bring anything of color in. <mp> Even if those colors are those of party lines and washes of the green, pink, and rainbow variety.<lc>Seems like the locusts are ravaging across the sidewalk, leaving nothing but unread pamphlets in their wake. One of them tries to hand you one. <mp>It's been too many years since high school forced you to you pay attention to your communal politics. <lc>The solicitor looks just as jaded as you. His polo shirt is subtly adorned with party and national colors. "Do you have a quick minute?", he asks.
[]>narrator:You are not in the mood for politics. Especially not from guys that wear polo shirts.

[]>solicitor:Good day to you, I don't want to take much of your time now. Just wanted to make you aware that we are in dire emergencies, and the government isn't doing anything about it. We from the National Strike promise a political program from the people, for the people. How's that sound?
[]>narrator:Trying to surpress your lisp and accentuate your voice training, you let your vocal chords resonate.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Cool.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:You probably just outed yourself with that stunt. Worthless boymoder.
[]>solicitor:You love to see it. Lemme just quickly hand you this, and then you can be on your way just fine.
[]>capra:...
[]>solicitor:Bye now.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:You leave without another word. It might be better that way.

[]>narrator:You briefly look it over. The front cover proudly displays the party emblem of National Strike Dosz. Neo-conservatives and the lot rally under them. People like your dad. <lc>The pamphlet finds the next best trash can as its new home.<lc>The remaining walk home is uneventful, as per usual.

[]>narrator:If it were up to you, this wouldn't even happen. tl;drs of everything mandatory. Public execution if you lie. <mp>Or something like that. Politics is so exhausting. <lc>You let the topic drift off of your working memory and continue on your foot commute home.

[]>narrator:The remaining distance of your walk home leads you through a lightly forested area. <mp>The serenity of rain on the horizon makes for a somber atmosphere. It feels like home in these woods.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|content}:You take a deep breath.
[]>capra:One day, I'll be hanging from those.
[]>narrator:If the forest hasn't died before then.
[]>capra:I will... remain... in good spirits.

[]>narrator:The good spirits leave you as you pass into the old residential district you call home.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:The old brickwork crushes your soul with its presence.

[]>narrator:You quickly walk up the steps to your apartment. <lc>Sticking out from your mailbox is another political leaflet from another party. Without even looking at it, it too, is immediately canned.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Just leave me alone.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:You boot up your PC, and sink into your chair. <lc>You occasionally try yourself as a writer. Part autobiography, part nightmare diary, these short stories are always weirdly personal to you. The words often rot and decay before they even hit the text editor.

[]>narrator:You begin writing:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:"I'm a digital vampire. I never go outside. I lurk in the dark. I feed off of the misery my LCDs deliver onto me. I bite. <mp> And I died, long ago."<lc>...<lc>God please kill me.
[]>narrator:Today is not the day to be satisfied with your work.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Man...
[]>narrator:You stare out into the distance. <ap>The fourth floor has its advantages.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I swear that polo shirt guy made me lose all my creative energy. <lc>That's just like dad... absolute neo-nationalist vermin.
[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Oh- <ap>Not thinking of those things now.

[]>narrator:The blurred out field of view from spiraling into another mental health slump is all that reaches your retinas.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Kill me. Kill me. Kill me. Kill me.
[]>narrator:It has been like this for a while.
[]>capra:I swear to god if anyone ever gives me shit for eating nothing but energy drinks and crap I'll kill them.
[]>narrator:You've been spiraling for a while now.
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:And you continue...
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:And continue...
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:And continue evermore, until you realize you are wasting aware in your office chair, staring at nothing.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:[infernal screaming]

[]>narrator:Your phone vibrates and reminds you of your related responsiblities: <mp> It's therapy time. <lc> Along with this singular task, your phone is littered with unread notifications. Maybe it's time for a bit of spring cleaning after this. <mp>But for now, you ought not to miss this.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Oh- <ap>It's already time.
[]>narrator:You open your emails, dodging the psychically damaging minefield that is deadnamed email addresses and navigate to the online consultation invite link your shrink sent you. <lc> You click the link.

[]>therapist:Good day, miss Kiln.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Hello.
[]>therapist:Quite the time we're living in, isn't it?
[]>capra:...
[]>capra:Pardon me, <ap>I don't think I get it.
[]>therapist:Oh... I just meant the news. <mp>So many new developments. 
[]>therapist:Have you heard of this new bill?
[]>capra:... <mp>Heh, sorry, I haven't.
[]>therapist:It is quite new. I've had numerous clients affected by it, this thing about curtailing vampires and witches and all that for the... <ap>supposed safety of the people.
[]>capra:...
[]>therapist:Oh well, enough of that.
[]>capra:I'm sorry, I don't really keep up with anything.
[]>therapist:And that's totally fine too! Perhaps healthy for yourself too.
[]>capra:I guess.
[]>therapist:So then... how have you been this past month?
[]>capra:Well, I started that mood and activity diary you recommended. It's been difficult remembering to write something down every couple of hours. <mp>It's also not particularly fun because it makes me remember my life.
[]>therapist:Oh, that's depressing to say, isn't it?
[]>capra:I guess. Isn't that also part of why I'm here?
[]>therapist:It is. <mp> But I'm glad to see you keep up with it to the extent to which you do. I've received your email with it.
[]>capra:Sure.
[]>therapist: Say... A few months ago in summer you described experiences that you described as something psychosis-like. I believe you spoke of visual hallucinations?
[]>capra: Mhm. That is true.
[]>therapist: Have those come back at all?
[]>capra: Not really, no. it seems they were a one-time thing as far as I can tell.
[]>therapist:And how have you been feeling with that over these months?
[]>capra:Weird... I guess. <lc> Like, it was so vivid and real. But I didn't like it so I also tried to look away. And that was so tough because I couldn't look away, it was like a different plane of existence. <ap>Or a different plane of vision I guess.
[]>therapist: You would not be alone with having some unexplainable one-off hallucination.
[]>capra: I guess...
[]>therapist:Do not worry, miss Kiln.
[]>therapist:Have there been any other developments that have happened since last month?

choices.choice_text.enabled: I think I just got more depressed.

content.content:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:I've come to realize I'm a vampire! I can feel my fangs grow out! And it makes me super happy because within the last week alone, I've connected with so many people online. <mp>So many shared experiences.
[]>therapist:A vampire. Yes, you see it in the news sometimes these days, don't you?
[]>capra:I guess.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:But it's not really like in the news. Not at all. There, they- <ap>we- <ap>get treated like criminals. But that's not really it? Vampirism can just develop in individuals. It can be helped along with certain medications though.
[]>therapist:And you take those?
[]>capra:I have access to them. And they work well. <mp>It feels so good.
[]>therapist:Well, that's fantastic news, isn't it? <mp>And you have read up on this now?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Yes, actually! <mp>If you look back in history, you can even find undiagnosed vampires, like people just dying of random stuff like sun exposure? Or all those ancient stories of cannibalism? <mp>Point A, most of those are untrue, but also. Yes. Those were vampires, probably. <mp>And I've also started my fangs growing in for quite some time now, I just didn't feel safe telling anyone about it before this. <ap>I'm also afraid of others seeing the fangs because... Well, how do I put this... <mp>my chest isn't a symbol of harm, excluding the patriarchy. So just taking hormones for being trans was a bit more low-key than the vampirism thing, and...<lc>...It's a bit scary...<lc>...<lc>I'm sorry, I'm rambling.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:I'm just excited to talk about this with anyone not online.
[]>therapist:It feels good talking about it, correct?
[]>capra:Yes.
[]>therapist:Well, I'm glad to hear that. Seems like there is a positive thing in your life now?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Well, conditionally. My parents also won't be accepting of that. <lc>I'm really not looking forward to Christmas this year, I have a bad feeling. <mp>I don't feel good about it because I just know my dad especially will say more exhausting shit.
[]>therapist:Are you afraid of the same things as last year?
[]>capra:Kinda. Yes, I am. <ap>Sort of.
[]>therapist:And not visiting them is not an option?
[]>capra:It'd probably be more work to explain to them why I don't want to go, than to just bear through it.
[]>therapist:Well, this is your decision. <ap>Just know that if it's an option, you can try to find a way out.
[]>capra:Maybe. I'll look into it.
[]>narrator:The conversation drifts off your vampirism. You're not sure how much else you could've talked about it anyways. You share some more about recent bigoted bullshit you've heard your dad say to you over the phone, and remain ecstatic about the few online contacts you made.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I just get... very sad sometimes.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:And I know that's nothing new, I just wish I could do something about it. <ap>Anything.<lc>So often I will just... hate the world for no good reason, no reason at all. Nothing founded, but then I want the world and myself to end.
[]>therapist:You mentioned this last time too. It's why you have that diary now.
[]>capra:Yeah. Doesn't feel like anything is changing, which I know is normal because I'm just recording this. All of this. But ugh. <lc>...<lc>I'm sorry.
[]>therapist:...
[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I think it gets worse around the days when I go to my parents.<lc>...<lc>Overall, they are exhausting to be around. <ap>But I don't want to talk about it. But overall it also makes sense. My life I mean. <ap>And me being sad. <mp>My job makes me want to kill myself, my parents are.. themselves. I don't have any friends. None in the actual real-life sense. I hate my life. <lc>And I hate questions about how I'm doing.<lc>Sorry.<lc>That was rude.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:And I mean, harking back to that psychosis thing, it just feels so awful to not be that reliable in the head.
[]>capra:...
[]>therapist:...
[]>narrator:The cadence of your speech slows down, sentences decay to mere fragments, and you forget words as soon as they leave your mouth. Your therapist makes diligent notes the entire time.

[]>therapist:I'm terribly sorry to say, this will already conclude our session today.
[]>narrator:You didn't get to everything you wanted to share. But this has to do for now.
[]>capra:Thank you. I'll keep up with that mood diary.
[]>therapist:Until next month. I'll send you the appointment over email again.
[]>capra:Thank you. Bye.
[]>narrator:And then you sit there. About two minutes of silence, just staring at the face in the webcam, hair all ruffled and fucked up by the headphones.

[]>narrator:Now that you have successfully slain the beast that is talking about your feelings, you could venture into the pit of unread text messages. There, a notification you've been neglecting for a bit now is waiting. <mp>It has been waiting there for over a day already. It is from your parents. <mp>You have a cold and difficult relationship to them. This will probably be about christmas plans. <mp> But this is just a simple text message, you should just read it. <ap>Right?

choices.choice_text.enabled: You are forgetting something. Don't open it.

content.content: []>mom{mom-emotion|text}:Hello child. <lc>I hope you're living well... For this christmas, we would like to have your here. You can come on the 23rd, just please let us know when you arrive here. Until then. Love...

[]>narrator:You compose a response.
[]>capra:Hello mom. Sadly I cannot do the 23rd.
[]>narrator:You don't want to.
[]>capra:But I can be there on the 24th, and maybe stay until the 26th. I'd be there around 5 pm.
[]>narrator:Maybe you won't even last the evening.<lc>You send the text.

[]>narrator:Just a few quick lines.
[]>capra:Hello mom. Sadly I am already occupied that evening.
[]>narrator:So alcoholism counts as an occupation now?
[]>capra:I will be hanging out with friends.
[]>narrator:Which ones?
[]>capra:But I wish you and dad a merry christmas regardless.
[]>narrator:You think this is how normal children talk to their parents. Once every couple of weeks. You cannot even remember when you last saw each other.
[]>narrator:Another time.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Oh how I love my life.
[]>narrator:As you sit there, the silence of the closed video call enveloping your mind, the little mental focus you used for that conversation with your therapist starts to dissipate.
[]>capra:I'm gonna go make instant noodles.
[]>narrator:10 minutes later, you do.

[]>narrator:The smell of barely-legal and definitely-harmful flavor enhancers is a delight to your underfed olfactory system. <lc>You set them down on your desk, and open your go-to social media slurry. A dull yet extreme array of content slop, doom scrolling, and bait. <lc>A long-buried image sequence of real gore and guts briefly flashes in your mental eyes.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Haven't had those thoughts in a while. <mp>Good job me, for growing up.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:You tab back to the contamporary flavor of what constitutes your online entertainment; <ap>nsfw artists, climate catastrophe news, a steady drip feed of the world's slipping into fascism, and a healthy dose of vampire and/or transgender related memes.

[]>narrator:And so you spend the rest of the day doing not much of anything. Any new job offers that might have found their way into your life are snuffed out by the fact that you actually never sent out any applications. <lc>As the evening drags on more and more, and after you've opened and closed your game collection like 20 times, the weight of inertia is crushing your soul.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Any one of those 20 will do.
There has to be something else.

content.content: []>narrator:You could make your brain rot more on social media.

[]>narrator:What else is there? <lc>Nothing.<lc>That's not true.<lc>It is.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Ugh.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:You notice some activity on a server you are on. KommKomm is where basically all your online contacts are. <mp>And even more strangers. Some even local to Helenia. From when you were one or two years younger and still trying to find connections. <lc>The icon of an active voice call hovers on screen, still and theatening. You could join them, but you'd probably be an outsider with no friends. Possibly even a stalker, considering these people live around here too. <mp>There might be vampires in there.
[]>capra:Oh my god I don't want this to get awkward.
[]>narrator:You need a decision, fast. Within a single movement, you jerk your mouse around, and click on the window of choice. It is...

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I can't believe I'm always this indecisive. <mp>Man... <ap>Just what is this?
[]>narrator:Your mouse cursor lands on one of the shooter games you played a few years back.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Just gonna zone out to these. <lc>...<lc>All...
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:...alone.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|content}:Alright.
[]>narrator:As you play your first match, you have some trouble getting back into <ap>the zone.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:This sucks.
[]>narrator:You lean forward.<lc>Your performance does not improve.
[]>capra:Hhhmnb... C'mon.
[]>narrator:It does not improve after the second match.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:COME ON! Just let me get one kill.
[]>narrator:And after a third bombed round...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I didn't think I'd ever say this. <mp>It's not fun anymore.
[]>narrator:Your brutally and unceremoniously close the game with a keyboard shortcut and switch to the one thing you know you have enough brain power for.
[]>narrator:You immediately find yourself within the comfort of your self-adopted home; social media.

[]>narrator:Your zen-like desolation is disturbed by the ever-rare soundscape of your phone ringing.<lc>It's your parents.
[]>mom{mom-emotion|phone}:My dear! <mp>How have you been?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Been fine. <ap>I've been fine.
[]>mom:That's great! 
[]>capra: Yup.
[]>mom:And are you still going out with your friends sometimes?
[]>narrator:You haven't had contact to anyone from your graduation class in over a year. <ap>You haven't bothered to fill your mom in on that detail.
[]>capra:Kinda. Yeah. Not really though.
[]>mom:Oh, well it's very busy in your life, isn't it?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Yes it is.
[]>mom:Well... and... How is work?
[]>capra:It's going good.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Nothing to complain about.
[]>mom:I'm glad for you, dear.
[]>capra:...
[]>mom:Say, you haven't responded to my text yet, so I thought I'd speed it up by calling you directly.
[]>capra:Oh yes. Sorry. I have been really busy, as you know.
[]>mom:Can't even take five minutes off for your parents, my child?
[]>capra:Sorry, mom.
[]>mom:Well, no matter.<lc>We wanted to make sure you know that we'd like you to be with us on Christmas.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Only on Christmas, or some more days surrounding that?
[]>mom:That would be up to you, of course. You're welcome to come and go as you want.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Agree to visit your parents on Christmas

content.content:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I probably can only do the day of. <lc>If that's alright with you.
[]>mom:I wish it would be longer. <ap>But oh well. It will suffice.
[]>capra:Great. Then I'll be there around the afternoon.
[]>mom:Love you, dear.
[]>capra:Same.<lc>Bye.
[]>mom:Goodbye.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'm afraid I just can't make it...
[]>narrator:Now you better come up with a reason.
[]>capra:I...<lc>Found some people from here that want to hang out then, and many of them can't celebrate with their families.
[]>narrator:At least one true fact in there. <mp>Good job.
[]>capra:I hope this isn't too upsetting to you. I'm really sorry.
[]>narrator:Laying it on thick to compensate for the missing snow?
[]>narrator:There is a short pause. Then your mom answers with an audibly deflated tone.
[]>mom:Sad. I would've hoped you could make it after a few months away from here.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:We'll see each other again, I'm sure.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I gotta go now. Bye.
[]>mom:Goodbye.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I cab't believe I'm stumbling right at the finish line.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm such a social failure.
[]>narrator:With the beast that is your parents quelled for the time being, your heart is racing to no end. <lc>To take your mind off of things, you open up your phone.
[]>narrator:This calls for some relaxation.<lc>You pull out your phone and start scrolling your feed.

[]>doomfeed:"32% of respondents told The Daily Coaster that they spend a significant amount of time each week keeping up with the finalists of "My Couch and I", making it even slightly more popular than politics. Looking at last week's poll, where just 29.5% of people said they invest that same amount of time into keeping up with the upcoming federal elections, it is clear that the public conscious is evenly split between the future of their communes, and their idols."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Oh yea because we don't have anything else to worry about!
[]>narrator:The trending sections justify your anger. <ap>The number of depressing news is ever-mounting.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:This is so bad. I hate this.

[]>narrator:From your fridge, you procure a beautifully chilled bottle of beer.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Thank you, yesterday me. <ap>For this.
[]>capra:To the early demise of my parents.

[]>narrator:After a big celebratory gulp, you turn back to your PC.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I don't know why I do this to myself.

[]>narrator:You find solace in your fridge, where yesterday's Capra left a few beers, among other staples of your diet. <mp>You skull half a bottle as soon as you take it out of the fridge.
[]>doomfeed:"The local councils have blamed My Couch and I's aggressive marketing on the lopsided nature of public topics."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:Yea, right. <mp>Thank you for not alienating all of the population.
[]>narrator:As you flick deeper into the tabs of the hellish news cycle, your first beer is nearing its end.

[]>narrator:Another one.
[]>capra:And one or two... or three... more shots.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:They could never hurt me.
[]>narrator:Never. <lc>Time to open your phone back up now.
[]>doomfeed:"Voter participation in the Helenia communal district continues its year-on-year decline. In a prediction for the upcoming elections, only 46% of eligible voters intent to cast theirs."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Because it never mattered.
[]>doomfeed:"...this coincides with a year-on-year increase for vote percentages for fringe parties on the ballot. These often have close ties to left-wing and right-wing extremist groups."
[]>narrator:You cannot remember the last time any left-leaning fringe party had any say here.

[]>narrator:Another empty bottle hits the floor.<lc>Another full bottle leaves your fridge.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:God bless shoplifting.
[]>narrator:As you return to the living room, sitting down to read up on how the world is going to shit seems like too arduous a task. <lc>You make your couch your new home.
[]>narrator:You open back your phone and refresh your feed. <mp>You are greeted by...
[]>yearnfarms:A big fluffy cuddlepile.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:I wish I were there.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I wanna... holsomeones hands... paws...
[]>yearnfarms:Between girls, even.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I'M NOT WORTHY OF YURI... <ap>damn. <mp>Oops.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Or maybe I am...<ap> hehe.
[]>narrator:Cheers to that.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Cheers.
[]>doomfeed:"Smoking is on the uptake for those aged 25 and under again, after almost two decades of decline in popularity."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Luckily I only use other things. <lc>Sssscrewww you stats... stastitsicks.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:...<mp>shit...
[]>narrator:You can feel the acute symptoms of alcohol abuse catching up to you, and your face meets the floor at a rapid pace.

[]>narrator:Time passed. Maybe an hour, maybe more. <lc> As you roll off the couch, empty bottles clink.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Ugh. <mp>Screw. <mp>This.
[]>narrator:You're already starting to sober up.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Nuh uh.
[]>narrator:You do something about it. <mp>The shot glass is right there.
[]>capra:I don't even like tequila that much...<lc>But it is right there. <mp>There.
[]>narrator:Three attempts, and you grasp it.

[]>narrator:The floor is more comfortable when drunk.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:My floor...
[]>narrator:When you close your eyes, you envison your temple. If this were the ancient times, you'd be worshipped and drunk off the daily wine. You're sure of it. <lc>A calm, marble meadow, pristine halls. An everflowing chalice of vino.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Blegh...
[]>narrator:Everflowing like your vomit. It's been a few minutes since you've found yourself half-dead, hanging on the edge of the toilet.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Fuck me...
[]>narrator:On a deep level, you feel satisfaction with this situation.
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:And arousal.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:End me.
[]>capra:One of these days I'm gonna have buckshot for dinner. <mp>Will be better than... <lc>...<lc>...this.
[]>narrator:You get back up. Your legs are wobbly.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'm still here.
[]>narrator:You look up in the mirror.<lc>And from where you missing reflection usually is, a murky mist starts swirling inside the mirror. <mp>And from it...
[]>metaspirit:I greet you, you wretched thing.
[]>narrator:Its voice is a hollow echo. It feels like tinnitus, audible, but nowhere around you. <lc>Its presence, without a shadow, exuding from within the bathroom mirror.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.

[]>capra:Alcohol isn't a hallucinogen.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:I'm about to die, aren't I?
[]>narrator:Is this what alcohol poisoning feels like?
[]>capra:Like I... I know I can be delulu...<mp>delusionally delusional.
[]>metaspirit:I am real.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:Stop it.
[]>metaspirit:You dragged me out.
[]>capra:AH WELL FUCK YOU...<mp>And get back there.<mp> Or in there. My head?
[]>metaspirit:I can't.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Fucking... you mean? <mp>Yeah, how do you mean?
[]>metaspirit:I can't-
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:
[]>capra:YEAH WHY IS THE GRIM REAPER COMING FOR ME WHEN I'M... <mp>I'M DRUNK AS SHIT!
[]>metaspirit:Capra. You are not dead.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:It knows my name...<ap>I never gave it out. <ap>What the fuuuuck.
[]>metaspirit:Capra.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:Stop saying my name. <mp>It's not even real.
[]>narrator:The floor is too uncomfortable for real talk. You attempt to get up.
[]>capra:Ugh...
[]>narrator:You do so. <ap>With effort.
[]>capra:Shit.
[]>metaspirit:You made yourself aware of me. I'll be there when you die. And at other points too, probably.
[]>capra:What even are you then?

[]>metaspirit:I'm the metaspirit of vampires.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Come again?<mp> Once more? <mp>Metaspirit? <mp>So I'm an actual vampire?
[]>metaspirit:Of course you are. <mp>I've been there since the first cases of vampirism emerged with you humans.
[]>capra:You're so casually... <ap>casual about all of this... <mp>Are you god?
[]>metaspirit:In some languages. <ap>In some time periods.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:This is too much for me. Especially right now. <ap>At the moment. Now, in the present. <mp>Can't you see I'm downsizing my brain and lifespan?
[]>metaspirit:I do not get drawn out at special points. <mp>Vampires do not summon me.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:So... <mp>I am delusional? Am I psychotic?
[]>metaspirit:That is between you and your therapist.
[]>capra:Also also, like. Respond to half of what I say you... fuck. <mp>I hate rhetorics. <ap>Rhetorical questions. <lc>Can you actually see me drink?
[]>metaspirit:Of course.
[]>capra:Then please leave me alone, if you're not going to kill me.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Kill me. I should kill myself, actually.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:GO FUCK YOURSELF NOT-GOD!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:AAAAAA.
[]>metaspirit:I just wanted to let you know of my existence.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Yes. Sorry. I'm fine.
[]>metaspirit:I've had worse reactions.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:You're not the first cryptic apparition in my vision. <mp>Just a very... <ap> persistent one.
[]>metaspirit:You may have seen me at some point eventually. <ap>Like I said. I'm just a tether from you, or what you may call your soul, to any vampirism to ever exist across spacetime.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:...<lc>...<lc>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>That's messed up.
[]>capra:So why again? <lc>Why are you here right now?
[]>metaspirit:It seems that you would be considered to have deteriorating mental health. According to. <ap>Everyone around you. And whatever it is, it's also strengthening other things.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:So... I am psychotic. Got it.
[]>metaspirit:If that's what you call it.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:
[]>capra:Point being?
[]>metaspirit:Vampires...
[]>capra:Actually, hold that thought. Lets not do this in the place where I usually piss and vomit.

[]>narrator:And with the determination of an ancient phalanx, you strut into your living room.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Heh.
[]>narrator:It is there again. Or already?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:FUCK.
[]>narrator:You point at it.
[]>capra:Where were you? <ap>...<ap>Yes. <ap>Vampires. Spit it out.
[]>metaspirit:Vampires are not a dying breed. We have always been there and will always coexist with humans. We are human. <mp>Some would disagree.<lc>But we are continuously being hunted. 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:So how come I can see you? <ap> And how come not alleone- <ap>everyone can see you? <lc>Not even... <ap>all vampires? <mp>How many seeing vampires are there anyways?
[]>metaspirit:Like I said, you dragged me out. Imagine rotating a cube. You cannot see all sides at once. Some sides are me. Some are other things you may never know. <mp> That cube is floating through a spiderweb in which you are caught your entire life. It may pass through you. Your inner self has to intersect with that path. And the road to that intersection is lined with what humans often call mental illness.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Uh huh. <lc>I'll just... <mp>Cube.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I am so wasted. No more imagining.
[]>metaspirit:Whatever you imagine. You will not be more powerful than the ties of community.
[]>capra:You talk in riddles.
[]>metaspirit:You will know.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Shu... Sure.
[]>metaspirit:Until again, Capra.
[]>capra:I already forgot... <mp>Did forget your name. <mp>I'm sorry.
[]>narrator:And then the tequila in your otherwise empty stomach claims you for the night.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Since you now live in my head-
[]>metaspirit:I've always lived there, if you desire that wording.
[]>capra:Whatever.
[]>metaspirit:But you having that first mirror fail on you made me visible.
[]>capra:And I shooed you away then.
[]>metaspirit:It worked for about five months.
[]>capra:Yeah yeah... now leave me alone.
[]>metaspirit:That is not with me. <mp>Not entirely, at least.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:What do you mean?
[]>metaspirit:This form is bound to you. As you are to vampirism.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Okay... okay. I feel an infodump so just let it rain and I'll forget half of it. I already apologize for that in advance but just tell me everything.<lc>...<lc>Actually, just the first few basics.
[]>metaspirit:...<lc>All vampiric powers draw upon the cosmic lattice. It is akin to a net, woven into the backbone of reality.
[]>capra:Uh huh...
[]>metaspirit:It is made up of two types of absolute-black darkness. The Abyss, like a deep ocean trench or a black hole. It swallows all and is unimaginably heavy. It constitutes the weave of the lattice. <mp>In the gaps is the Void, an emptiness akin to space.<lc>Without context, a black hole and the space surrounding it seem indistinguishable to an observer. Such is the nature of non-vampires. <lc>Your heart is strung along the lattice, Capra. And within the delta of existence, you find the eldritch. And- <ap>me.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.
[]>capra:Sure thing. This is insane.

[]>metaspirit:If you call it that.
[]>capra:And you live in my eyes because some hidden--- parallel dimension of my backbone is fused with the dark side of the universe?
[]>metaspirit:That is not very correct if we go by the definitions of your language and words. <lc>But you could explain it like that also.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I'm sorry I'm too stupid to understand this stuff.
[]>metaspirit:You need not fret. It may come with time.
[]>capra:If you say so...

[]>metaspirit:Vampiric meditations have always held great power. Take for instance the powers of premonition some witches wield. Some vampires can drag out the future innately.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Aren't there only vanishingly few of those?
[]>metaspirit: You have been to the dentist. How do they fix your teeth? By drilling away the rotten parts, and every so slightly more to anchor the filling.
[]>capra: So... You being here is bad? Is that right?
[]>metaspirit: Not necessarily. You just erode a bit of extraneous reality in exchange for a refined part of your own.
[]>capra: I don't think i understand.
[]>metaspirit: Reality may crumble evermore. It will do so unrelenrtingly anyways.
[]>capra: Not... not as if there's been anything worthwhile about it.
[]>metaspirit: You are such a cynical one. <lc> Yet, you will build a great temple. 
[]>capra: I doubt that. I'm sorry, I really do hehe.
[]>metaspirit: In time, Capra.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Okay so... I'm hung over and building a temple. I have an inner sanctuary but you... I don't want you there. <lc>Please leave.
[]>metaspirit:I'm afraid I can't. How resonant you are with the lattice cannot be changed, and that is what dictates you seeing this form.
[]>capra: Sooo... You're like a demon?
[]>metaspirit: Perhaps. Your language is restrictive like that. I could also be called the collective unconscious, the shared cultural web tying everything together. <mp>I am the realization that you are a vampire.
[]>capra: But the only other vampires I know are online. I'm a neet. <lc>...<mp>A neet without the umemployed part, but still functionally useless. Also my job is killing me. <mp>I'm a neet with reduced free time.
[]>metaspirit: And there is no culture within that? No shared customs?
[]>capra: We have our memes and stuff... But you can't be meaning to tell me that this is like this for every vampire out there.
[]>metaspirit: Not like this of course. <mp>Some never witness the metaspirit in their entire lives.
[]>capra:You're no sleep paralysis demon. Not a vision of the end. <mp>Not a god. <mp>But some glue between the souls of vampires.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Now please leave me alone.
[]>metaspirit:...
[]>metaspirit:...
[]>capra:Please go. You make it so difficult to relax. <ap>It's... exhausting already.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Very.
[]>metaspirit:Very well. I leave now you to go back to lobotomizing yourself on social media. Enjoy your time there.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Thank you.<lc>Just what in the hell. Why me?
[]>narrator:But there is nothing but silence giving you answer.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Man...
[]>narrator:You pull out your phone. Might as well get back to doing what you loathe a bit less.

[]>narrator:On second thought, you'd probably barge in at an inopportune time. Someone would be sharing a really engaging story, only for you to completely disrupt them.
[]>capra:Actually, let's browse some other channels. Text channels. <ap>Text channels.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Browse text channels on that server.
Join the voice chat for real.

content.content:
[]>narrator:You hop online. A litany of archive links has been collecting dust in a text file on your desktop for only-god-knows-how-long now. You've been meaning to read up on knitting. And playing that guitar you got... as a preteen?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Why should I remember.
[]>narrator:You shouldn't.
[]>capra:I don't.<lc>Any random one of the links will do. Anything to kill the time.
[]>narrator:You say to yourself.
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:Several of them have died to linkrot.
[]>capra:Any random one of the still-working links will do.
[]>narrator:A few copy-and-paste operations and you have found yourself reading up on bear attack survival techniques, interspursed with watching arbitrary history documentaries.<lc>"Historically, Leventians have lived in the territory claimed by the Phean State..."<lc>"When encountering a wild bear, do not panic. <mp>Find peace with death instead."<lc>"Doszbianese teen suicide rates continue to climb in the light of a warming biosphere and degraded standards of living. Ruling parties are at a loss."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:... ugh.

[]>narrator:Within a minute, you find yourself keeled over your toilet, vomit dripping from your chin.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Lovely.
[]>narrator:This is not the first time. Ever since you quit purging yourself, you still get the muscle reflex involuntarily.
[]>capra:But it'll get better.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:Right?<lc>...
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|hung-over}:...<lc>I should get back up.
[]>narrator:The reflection staring back at you in the mirror is a pale and decrepit thing. <mp>Mirrors are a weird thing. Their reflections, reliable for everyone and everything but vampires. <mp>Most vampires just do not have a reflection, but some leave traces behind, like afterimages that are burned blurrily into the mirror. <ap>You're happy you're not one of those.

[]>narrator:You've experienced worse.<lc>You go back to learning about how the world is perpetually going to shit.<lc>"Remember that the best tactic in a mugging situation is to run away."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Show me how to run away from my apartment then. <mp>Fucking... <ap>gonna kill landlords.
[]>narrator:The edutainment slop continues playing over your thoughts.

[]>narrator:This does not feel productive. You're reading up on stuff you don't care about, for situations that will never arise anyways, and even if they were to happen, you'd freeze up and collapse anyways. <lc>Even if the prospect of talking to others terrifies you, there is still something to be gained from work others have actually curated. You could check back on the server if there are any... more intriguing pieces of literature.

[]>narrator:You scroll through the many resources people keep sharing there. For most files, you don't even know all of the words in their titles. <lc>"Critiques of Material Dialectics" <lc>"Late-stage ultraliberalism in the context of post-colonial uprisings"<lc>"On War against Petit Bourgeois."<lc>You find a video that seems approchable. <mp>"Don't talk to the police." <lc>You have no idea why that would be a bad idea. You've never talked to them anyways.
[]>narrator:And after a bit, you've sunken into your chair and the words reflect off of your brain as always.
[]>narrator:Minutes pass, you can barely focus on the video, and you're also bored to death.

[]>capra:Hm?
[]>narrator:A notification. You never get those.
[]>narrator:It's in the same text channel you got the video link from. <lc>"@nerds if any of you are reading stuff this evening, join me because I am severely bored"
[]>capra:As am I.
[]>narrator:As are you.<lc>It continues.<lc>"in return you will receive knowledge"
[]>capra:At this point I could rip my brainstem out. <ap>I might. <lc>But first, I can have this cretin infodump on me.

choices.choice_text.enabled: What's the worst that could happen?

content.content:
[]>icy-aloe:Hi.
[]>narrator:Maybe you should have killed yourself half a year ago afterall.
[]>capra:.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<mp>Hi.
[]>icy-aloe:Who do I have the pleasure of meeting here today?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Ummm... Capra. Hello, hi.
[]>icy-aloe:Glad to meet you.<mp> I'm Icy, what are you reading up on?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Nothing really. Well I was watching that one video someone sent in here recently. The one about police. Not talking to them and stuff.
[]>icy-aloe:Oh yes, how did you like it?
[]>capra:It was...
[]>narrator:Try to recall anything. <ap>Anything. <ap>Any one thing at all.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:......
[]>narrator:Say a word.
[]>capra:I don't know. Sorry.

[]>narrator:What now? Just what are you doing here?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:To be honest, I can't remember.
[]>icy-aloe:Haha, that's fine! That essayist can be quite dense and inapproachable if you're not used to it. He has a background in super-dry academia.
[]>capra:Huh. Interesting. I get it.
[]>icy-aloe:I eventually drifted further into anti-psychiatry and such, if you'd like to know where that rabbit hole can go. <lc>Or we just talk a bit about the police video if you like.

[]>capra:So... I don't really know you, honestly.
[]>icy-aloe:Oh of course, apologies. <mp>Hello, well met, I'm Icy Aloe, she/they. What's your name, fine traveler?
[]>narrator:She is making fun of you, can't you see?
[]>capra:Capra.
[]>icy-aloe:Your nametag betrayed you!
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Did you put your deadname somewhere?
[]>icy-aloe:I already knew that because of your username.
[]>narrator:Maybe not.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Yeah.
[]>icy-aloe:I joined this here hot sauce enjoyers server several moons ago... <mp>Sustaining that medieval-type speak is really difficult, you know?<lc>But yes, I knew, or know, one of the founding members, Starry, and they invited me pretty quickly because this is kind of a socializing-slash-cross-polination-server. <mp>So now I just keep on talking to random people about intellectual stuff when I have time, once in a blue moon.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Cool. Yeah, that's neat.
[]>icy-aloe:Thanks! What's lead you here?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Mental illness. <mp>I just looked for friend groups online and found an invite link to this.
[]>icy-aloe:Weird, really? <mp>I can't remember us ever making it... that public.
[]>capra:Oh, it was a really small and local forum. Maybe someone you know posted it there?
[]>icy-aloe:That could be it. <mp>But does that mean you're also from Helenia?
[]>capra:...<ap>Yes.
[]>icy-aloe:Oh that's so fun. <mp>Well, if you're here on the server because of it, would you like to hang out with some other people from here? We recently discussed a concert coming up, and you could join us!
[]>capra:I don't know. It's pretty spontaneous.
[]>narrator:You hate people, too.
[]>icy-aloe:Well, let me know if you'd like to tag along. 
[]>narrator:You're afraid of them.
[]>icy-aloe:You're always welcome!
[]>narrator:And they are of you.
[]>icy-aloe:Just you know, be chill and punch fascists and all that. <mp>You do agree to that, right?
[]>capra:I guess. I haven't thought of it much. Isn't it against democracy?
[]>icy-aloe:That depends on what you mean by democracy. But if you let fascists exist without pushback they will take everything, and as a trans person with many other queer people and other marginalized groups around her, I don't fancy that.
[]>narrator:You're neither trans or a vampire then.
[]>capra:Violence is bad, I think.
[]>icy-aloe:Yes it is. <lc>...<lc>I'm afraid I'll come off as preachy now but I gotta get this outta my system.
[]>capra:I don't mind. Sure.
[]>icy-aloe:Marginalized groups need to be able to defend themselves. <mp>I obviously don't know if you have experience with that, but exclusionary behavior is not cool. And it should be fought against.
[]>capra:Sorry.
[]>icy-aloe:Ah don't be, it's just a really sensitive topic for me... <mp>Did you catch wind of those riots a few years back?
[]>capra:No? I don't think so.
[]>icy-aloe:So there were these riots over the tageted murder of a queer person 4-ish years ago. <lc>I was there. We have to show we can defend ourselves because others won't do it for us.
[]>capra:Hm.
[]>icy-aloe:Bit of a heavy topic to start off with, I'll admit.
[]>capra:Honestly, yea.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:It's all my convos ever are tho. I'm not one for small talk much.
[]>icy-aloe:Heh, likewise. <lc>Point being. Our local community is vulnerable, and we mentally ill people gotta stick together. <mp>I'm doing finger guns right now to relax the situation, oh well.
[]>narrator:Could they be even more awkward than you? Is it possible?
[]>icy-aloe{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Capra?
[]>capra:Yea?
[]>icy-aloe:I'm so sorry this was such a short and intense convo, but I gotta head out now.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:You're good.
[]>icy-aloe:Heh. I know. <lc>All of us trans people are.<lc>...

[]>capra:My head hurts from the video. Could you like... <ap>break it down? I'm sorry, I feel so stupid asking this.
[]>icy-aloe:Don't be! That's what I put the ping out for, afterall. <lc>So how much do you know about police abolitionism?
[]>capra:Basically nothing I think. I only really watched the video, and not a lot of it. And I understood nothing.
[]>icy-aloe:That's fine. <ap>So fundamentally, the police are not your friends. Regardless of what they say, or how they treat you, they are not on your side on a systemic level. If you get beat up at a train station, they will probably interfere to keep the peace, but if you're part of a minority or... <ap>Look vaguely leftist, you could very well be on the other side of the law in the aftermath.
[]>capra:Really? I don't get it.
[]>icy-aloe:The more your talk, the more they can use to rationalize any advantage you have away. <lc>And even more importantly, they work against all of us on a systemic level. They uphold the violence the state inflicts upon us. You know, queer people, people of color, anyone with altered physical traits. <lc>You may recall last year, there were a few cases of police surrounding people that were doing... nothing? There was a lot of footage of bruised faces and broken limbs online back then.
[]>capra:That was around where I live, it was so scary. Only one city over.
[]>icy-aloe:Exactly. Same for me actually. <lc>A few of my friends got prosecuted for resisting their brutality and stuff the police had on file from years ago was also brought up to sanction them even harder.
[]>icy-aloe:...And there were exactly zero consequences for any of the aggressors. <mp>Therefore, do not talk to cops.
[]>narrator:Don't do stupid shit.
[]>capra:That's so scary. I hate it here.
[]>icy-aloe:Likewise. You said you were also around there? Helenia by any chance?
[]>narrator:Are you really gonna give your info to these fuckwits?
[]>capra:Yes.
[]>narrator:Well spoken, Capra. Doesn't matter if you get killed by psychos. Or the police.
[]>icy-aloe:Oh that's just too funny. At least we both hate it in the backwater of Doszbian.
[]>capra:I don't have much of a choice. I can barely afford my place.
[]>icy-aloe:I've known many people with similar struggles. It's awful. <lc>Do you get out often?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I don't know... I really don't. I'm sorry.
[]>narrator:Get a grip.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Whatever.
[]>icy-aloe:Oh it's fine Capra. I was just asking because a few friends from this server will be going to a local show, and you could absolutely tag along. Queer solidarity and connections and networks and all that. <mp>I've seen events like that work wonders for your outlook on life.
[]>capra:I'll think on it.
[]>icy-aloe:Please do.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:What is anti-psychiatry?
[]>icy-aloe:So this all started ages ago when a friend of mine was admitted for self-destructive behavior. Locked away for months. He didn't kill himself, luckily, but it also fucked him up just the same. <mp>Really nothing new when you're queer.<lc>But fundamentally, the police, and the state, and societal expectations of normalcy will always be exclusionary.
[]>narrator:Following, barely.
[]>icy-aloe:Basically, if you look back far enough, all mental illnesses are across the entire spectrum of "pillar of society" and "reason for public execution". <lc>Especially things like hallucinations, schizophrenia, and also ADHD or autism are not disabilties, I believe. <mp>They're just modifiers to how you see reality.
[]>capra:Perhaps even a reality that doesn't suck?
[]>icy-aloe:Ah yes, perhaps even that, too. <mp>No guarantees of course.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:There's never any guarantees.
[]>icy-aloe:Perhaps sadly so.
[]>icy-aloe:<ap><ap>...And I just experienced the psychological torture these systems and standards cause with my friend.
[]>capra:And you're still friends?
[]>narrator:What kinda question is that?
[]>icy-aloe:I'm glad we still are! It has been years and things have gotten a bit better for him. <mp>And obviously better for me.<lc>We're actually famous, haha. <ap>About two years ago we were in the local news because we started a philosophy-slash-self help group where we live.  We made it nightly because all of the depressed people sleep all day. I haven't been there in over a year though.
[]>icy-aloe:We even got a few vampires, which was really cool because they get shunned so much. It's the other main reason why we made it nightly. <mp>Every two weeks. Good times.
[]>capra:I also went to something like that once. <ap>I only went twice I think.
[]>icy-aloe:Oh really, also with vampire accomodation? Because we actually found a local sponsor for consentual blood access, which was super hard to source.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:I am one. <mp>So yea, they had it. It was nice.
[]>icy-aloe:Oh, why did you stop going?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Just.. didn't feel like it. There wasn't anything to do. Or anyone to talk to.
[]>icy-aloe:Ah yes, I get it. Well I'm sure you'd always be welcome if you were to go back. <mp>Where was this, by the way? If you don't mind me asking. Because I just like to keep tabs on safe spaces, I know so many people all over the place.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Helenia, it's like... <ap> south... <ap>the center of Doszbian. <ap>And a bit down and left.
[]>icy-aloe:No way.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:What?
[]>icy-aloe:I know where that is. <lc>It's where I live.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:...
[]>narrator:Congratulations, you doxxed yourself.
[]>icy-aloe:This is too funny. <mp>Somewhere in the north of Helenia then?
[]>capra:...
[]>icy-aloe:I hope you're not scared now. <mp> I don't have much to gain from fucking with random people.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'm fine. <lc>Yes it was up there.
[]>icy-aloe:Okay good. Let me know if this is too many details. <mp>But yes...
[]>icy-aloe:So unsirprisingly, if you're one of the queer people, queer vampires even, here, you will probably know how difficult it is to find anything a safe space. Ultimately, I just want us to live together and to not be prejudiced against different lenses of reality, or ability to function under capitalism.
[]>narrator:Sure.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I get it... <mp>I think.
[]>icy-aloe:... just to quickly put a bowtie on the anti-psychiatry thing. <lc>There's actually a concert around there soon-ish. If you want you want, you could come along. There's also a bunch of other cool people from the server there.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:That's a lot of social interaction at once.
[]>capra:Maybe.
[]>icy-aloe:Don't sweat it.

[]>icy-aloe:Well, Capra. I gotta go now, I have some band practice and workout afterwards coming up... about 10 minutes ago. So I'll have to excuse me now. But I'll send you the link to the concert asap, and I hope I can see you there!
[]>capra:See you around.

[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Let's review.
[]>capra:End my life. <mp> Please. Please. Please. Please. Please. Please. Please. Please. Please. Please. Please. Please.
[]>narrator:You've met someone. They are chill.
[]>capra:They want to take my organs. <mp>And are better at being trans than I am.
[]>narrator:Sure she is.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Dysphoria... Not now.<lc>......<lc>Sigh....
[]>narrator:Make it shut up then.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Drink and rot your brain on social media.

content.content: []>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I can't keep drowning myself in sorrow and booze.

choices.choice_text.enabled: This also won't make it shut up. Find another solution.

content.content:
[]>narrator:...<lc>...<lc>................
[]>narrator:What then?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I have nothing else to live for. <mp>We're going to that concert.
[]>narrator:We are?
[]>capra:We are.
[]>narrator:Who is "we"?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:...

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'll never get over this drinking problem.
[]>narrator:Maybe in time.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:That'd be nice.<lc>Now... I think I should look at ticket prices.

[]>narrator:A few days later, you find yourself on a train. You're still riding the wave of dissociation from interacting with another human being and then having a small ego-breakdown to really think about anything you're doing.<lc>On autopilot, you <ap>looked up ticket prices, <ap>found out they're only sold at the door, <ap>asked Icy about when and where to meet, <ap>put a reminder in your phone's calendar, <ap>and you only almost relapsed on purging twice within the last four days.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Social anxiety is going great.

[]>narrator:You always try to stay informed. You have some vague knowledge of what's going on.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:"Staying informed" is a form of mental self-harm!
[]>narrator:Yet, you open four different social media tabs.
[]>capra: And you know I'm good at that.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Ugh.

[]>doomfeed:You skip through a video of a warzone hospital getting hit by an airstrike. It's from today. The comms operator of the recording laughs his ass off. <lc>Most leaked footage of the Phea/Leventia conflict is like this.
[]>yearnfarms:The dismemberment is interspersed with drawings of cute and attractive anime women.
[]>capra:God I wish that were me.
[]>doomfeed:More news! Predictions for the upcoming federal elections have the National Strike Dosz at 37%.
[]>capra:Fucking fascists. Great.
[]>doomfeed:The Doszbianese moderates, Allied Power, who took a stance against NSD just five months ago, are now entering potential approaches to the far-right party.
[]>capra:Bro just kill me.
[]>yearnfarms:This is immediately followed up by a sketch of an artist's black-haired anime OC.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:And kill me with those thighs too. <ap>Heh.
[]>doomfeed{capra-emotion|sad}:Refugee numbers out of Leventia keep rising, as Phean forces keep encroaching upon Leventian cities.
[]>narrator:You open the thread.
[]>doomfeed:"Good. We must stand united against those Leventian monsters."<lc>"When are we dropping a nuke on them?"<lc>"They chose this conflict."
[]>narrator:Thousands of civilians have been killed already.

[]>capra:I cannot wait to hear all that when I visit my parents.
[]>narrator:Hating Leventians is the mainstream opinion.

[]>narrator:Your parents likely hold the same views.
[]>capra:Good thing I won't be seeing them any time soon.<lc>I hope.

[]>narrator:The thread continues. Calls for ceasefires are compared to suicide.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Just kill yourselves.
[]>yearnfarms:Imagine amputating someone while they are chained up in your basement. Forever yours.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Would also absolve them from working retail... should be done to be. <ap>Someone please.
[]>narrator:It goes on like this. An eternal cycle of thirst for sex and hunger for bloodshed. Sometimes, they even intersect.
[]>doomfeed:"In a hallmark case of the witching rights movement, survivors of the 1981 prosecutions have finally received compensation."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Let me guess, more insignificant bullshit?
[]>doomfeed:"They are posed to receive large payouts as compensation for being the victims of isolated incidents, which plaintiffs allege to be 'symptoms of systematic discrimination'."
[]>capra:...
[]>doomfeed:"Critics have furthermore decried the act as being too little too late, as almost all of the mortal witches from that era are now in retirement, any it not addressing many of the core issues of witch hunts. Core issues, which the ruling and opposition party defend as neccessary evils to protect the purity of society."

[]>narrator:As the evening drags on, one solitary direct message lands in your inbox. It's from Icy Aloe.<lc>"Hi again, we're just planning a local hangout and in case you don't read the ping in time, here's the link:" <lc>Clicking on it leads you to a concert info page. Seems like tickets are bought at the door. <lc>The music is absolutely not to your taste, and you don't even really know anyone there! You only exchanged the briefest of words with Icy, and that is it. <mp>There is honestly not much reason for you to go.
[]>capra:And I should not impose on them anyways. <mp>There's a good chance they're just doing it out of politeness, because I'm from here and-
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:So damn pathetic-<ap> FUCK.
[]>capra:sniffle...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Anyways.

[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:This is all too much for you.
[]>capra:This is so bad.
[]>narrator:The feeling of regret is swelling in your chest.
[]>capra:Why did I not go...
[]>narrator:You are desperately close to reaching connection.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I will just...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:Man... <lc>I hate this...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:The next time. <lc>This was just too fast for me. But next time. <mp>Next time I have the opportunity, I won't say no.

choices.choice_text.enabled: You could always go now. Hurry.
You have a plan. Next time will work out.
Just shrivel up and die. Alone. At home.

content.content:
[]>metaspirit:Capra.
[]>narrator:Your blood freezes over once again. <mp>You never expected your sleep paralysis demons to be this lucid.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Why are you in my life?
[]>metaspirit:Are you planning on rotting in your bed forever?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Tact. Don't touch my heart like that. I just woke up.
[]>metaspirit:There is naught to touch. <ap>And that's the problem.
[]>capra:Leave me alone. Go away.
[]>narrator:You pull your blanket over yourself. <lc>It does not vanish from your vision.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:WHY DO YOU LIVE INSIDE MY EYES?
[]>metaspirit:Because I am not bound to your physical reality.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Fuck off. I'll get up in a bit.
[]>metaspirit:Capra. When you look into the future, do you want to see a shriveled and frail body?
[]>capra:No. This is already horrible.
[]>metaspirit:So grab my hand then. Grasp the future. The non-vampires won't know a lick about it.
[]>narrator:You reach out. <mp>In the infinite fraction of the moment and point of contact, it vanishes.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}: I hate how this feels like nothing.<lc>Maybe I should go do something with my life. With my fellow vampires. Just this once.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Once I find out how to connect with others...

[]>rider:...and that's where I also draw the line. <mp>Call me a puritan if you want. <mp>Saying hot dogs are sandwiches is like saying tea is soup. You might have some shared ingredients, but ultimately, they are different things.
[]>starry:And I'm saying it doesn't matter because if you give someone who wants a sandwich a hot dog, it will be largely the same reaction, because both are the same category of flavor profile.<lc>Also, hi... Capra!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Uhmmm...<mp>Hi.
[]>angel:Oh good, a fifth person. Hey, Capra. Are hot dogs sandwiches?
[]>capra:Huh?
[]>crosscull:You will now be roped into the most asinine thing.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I don't get it.
[]>starry:Okay Capra, so you know how a sandwich just means stuff between bread? This would mean that hot dogs are sandwiches. And I think that makes sense because they also occupy the same flavor region in culture. So effectively, in common usage, they can be used interchangeably.
[]>rider:And Angel and I say that this is stupid, because who would ask for a hot dog, and just accept any random-ass sandwich? <mp>Also, hot dogs have one piece of bread in them. Sandwiches have two.
[]>angel:Sooooo?

[]>rider:Yes, exactly!! Thank you!
[]>starry:Aw, come on.
[]>capra:It's just more logical that way to me. 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Why would I want to get a hot dog when I ask for a sandwich. They are not the same. Look at any restaurant menu. <mp>Especially at diners.
[]>rider:Hell yea! I didn't even consider that one.

[]>starry:Finally, someone with some common sense.
[]>angel:It really isn't as much common sense as you think it is.
[]>starry:It is!
[]>capra:Yes it is.
[]>crosscull:Joining the VC and immediately giving backtalk. Funny.
[]>angel:Very fun.
[]>crosscull:No harm meant with that, by the way.
[]>capra:No worries.
[]>rider:Damn... <ap>Insane opinions, all of you.

[]>rider:But like... that's part of the fun.
[]>starry:Yea, you can have stupid opinions too.
[]>angel:Well some people don't need stupid discussions in their life!

[]>rider:...well, you don't need to have a stance on this. <mp>It's just a stupid little fun discussion, you know?
[]>starry:Exactly...
[]>narrator:Eventually, the convo moves on from sandwiches.

[]>rider:Fruit tier list.
[]>starry:F tier. All of them.
[]>crosscull:Motion for summary dismissal of Starry. Vitamins are good. <lc>S tier across the board.
[]>starry:Stop being so healthpilled.
[]>crosscull:Do not engage in condemnable behavior if you do not wish to be judged.
[]>starry:I'm just saying, fruits suck ass.
[]>rider:Yeah!! Like hell I'm gonna give up my carby sandwiches. There's a bunch of sugar in apples and shit anyways.
[]>crosscull:That's mostly the juice boxes.
[]>angel:There definitely are some disgusting fruit out there. But I also like not dying of scurvy, so CC definitely has a point.
[]>rider:Mangos are A tier though.
[]>angel:Wrong.<lc>What about you, Capra?

[]>narrator:Over time you get bored of sitting on the sidelines.
[]>capra:Bye, everyone.
[]>rider:Well that's about the entire spectrum of opinions to have.

[]>starry:Do you, just not have opinions.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I guess not.
[]>narrator:Eventually, the people in the voice call get tired of you not offering much play.

[]>angel:What if it's not though...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I just don't like discussions that much.
[]>starry:Keeping out of drama online *is* a smart move. 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Oh no, I do keep up with that. <mp>But there I only have to read, not talk.

[]>starry:Oh my god, same.
[]>angel:And you're all gonna die of scurvy!
[]>capra:I'm married to my instant ramen.
[]>angel:That's even worse!

[]>angel:Now that is fucked up.
[]>rider:Yes, what the fuck.
[]>capra:I don't eat much. I don't eat many fruits. This is basically the only way I will.
[]>crosscull:Questionable.

[]>rider:Hey people, I just saw a post by that venue we went to a few weeks ago. They're putting on another hardcore show.
[]>starry:Sweet.
[]>angel:Ooooh yeah. Let's go there.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Leave and get a drink. You contribute nothing.
You don't need them. You can just drink the night away.
THERE IS NOTHING WORTHWHILE ABOUT THIS
What if there is and you don't know it yet?

content.content:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:What concert?
[]>angel:Like four weeks ago we all went to a show. It was a good concert.
[]>rider:It fucking ruled.
[]>rider:And yes, anyways, that venue just posted another banger lineup.
[]>rider:You should also live here, right? According to your intro in that intro text channel.
[]>capra:I do. Yes.
[]>rider:Then you're totally welcome to tag along.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:What am I doing with my life...

[]>narrator:A few minutes later, you make an attempt at an answer.
[]>capra:My life... can't remember. But I know what else I can do to pass the time.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Alcoholism.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|drunk}:Whatever.
[]>capra:This fucking sucks.<mp> Why must my life be so fucking miserable? God. Fuck.
[]>narrator:Overall, your mental state is immediately more wobbly. <mp>You haven't eaten anything all day and it's almost midnight.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Yea, I'd love to come with you guys.
[]>narrator:What are you getting yourself into?
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:YOU DON'T KNOW ANY OF THESE PEOPLE!
[]>rider:Great!
[]>capra:Umm... I usually like to listen to bands before I attend their concert, would you have something to recommend, Rider?
[]>rider:Haha not really. I don't know the bands, but the location is cool and it's always good fun.
[]>crosscull:Precisely.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Wait... So... <ap> Sooo... Do any of you know any of the bands?
[]>rider:Nope.
[]>crosscull:Negative.
[]>angel:It's just gonna be a fun group activity!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Heh... Okay.
[]>narrator:This is insane. What are you doing?
[]>rider:So... I gotta get going. Starry forgot groceries again.
[]>starry:We can have rice again!
[]>rider:And with what?

[]>crosscull:Can put pineapple on it.
[]>narrator:Are xe mocking you?
[]>starry:God no.
[]>narrator:They are mocking you.
[]>crosscull:It can be good. Sweetness contrasted with savoriness.

[]>angel:It's not like you have any fruit there.
[]>starry:Tell me, why would I put those on rice of all things?
[]>rider:Mangos...
[]>narrator:Get out of here...
[]>crosscull:Precisely. Rider has some culinary sense.

[]>narrator:It's been two hours. You feel shaky and exhausted and like you are about to evaporate.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I also gotta go now.
[]>angel:Take care!

[]>narrator{capra-emotion|hung-over}:You slump down into your chair. You feel drained.
[]>capra:Let's see how this turns out. <mp>I really don't want to find out.
[]>narrator:There isn't much of anything in your mind now. <lc>You do remember to put up a sticky note reminding you of the concert date though.
[]>narrator:A few days later, you find yourself exiting a regional train. You haven't taken those in ages.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm so gonna regret this.
[]>narrator:But driven by your intoxicated state suspending your anxieties, you head out later that evening. <lc>The sleep you get between then and now is incredibly low-quality.

[]>narrator:You arrive at the venue shortly after the doors opened for the night. <lc>The train ride there was uneventful, and a solid crowd of people is waiting outside. <ap>Most of them are smoking.

[]>narrator:Angel sent you a photo of their group earlier, so technically you know you're supposed to look out for a very colorful group of mostly-vampires. <mp>But between your nervousness, and not feeling confident just approaching basically-strangers, you have no chance in hell to find who you're looking for.

[]>narrator:Icy sent you a a photo of their group earlier, so technically you know you're supposed to look out for a very colorful group of mostly-vampires. <mp>But between your nervousness, and not feeling confident just approaching basically-strangers, you have no chance in hell to find who you're looking for.
[]>narrator:It is now that you realize that you never had any idea of how to look for any of the people that will be there.

[]>narrator:You will get yourself killed. <lc>Realisticaly, you should just turn around and call it quits, tell them you couldn't find the venue, or got into a car accident, or something, and hope this doesn't get any more involved than it already has. <mp>Then you'll be able to vanish back into your apartment and-
[]>rider{capra-emotion|spiraling,rider-emotion|excited}:CAPRA!!!
[]>narrator:You turn towards the noise. Your heart is pounding through your ribcage. <lc>Rider waves at you. He looks like you remember from the image. But you never sent any of them one. <mp>He probably just clocked you. That's the only explanation.<lc>Self-sufficiently, he steps towards you.
[]>rider:Hehe, knew it.
[]>capra:...<lc>Hi.
[]>rider:Sorry, didn't mean to scare you like that. I was a neet once too, and I made a bet with the others I'd spot your ass before you get mine.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Hm.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Shit, I'll- <ap> Give you the free drink from the bet. Wanna go to the others?
[]>narrator:You're already regretting coming here.
[]>capra:Sure.

[]>angel:Hello there.
[]>icy-aloe:Rider, you can be so loud sometimes.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Yep. That you can be.
[]>rider:I know. I know.
[]>angel:Anyways, hi Capra!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Hi... I didn't bring anything, is that okay?
[]>angel:Huh? What would you want to bring?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I don't know... Sorry. <mp>I've never been to a concert, so...
[]>rider{rider-emotion|excited}:Haha, you're a weird one.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Sorry.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|serious}:God, Rider.
[]>narrator:They turn to you.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Capra, you're fine.
[]>icy-aloe{capra-emotion|spiraling}:But...
[]>angel:Wanna go inside? It's getting cold out and the good spots inside are also running out.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Was just about to ask that.

[]>narrator:As the six of you head inside, the group splits up.
[]>rider:We're gonna go grab something to drink, want something?
[]>angel:No thank you.
[]>crosscull:No.
[]>narrator:Angel and Crosscull head off towards the crowd.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Stay with Rider, Starry, and Icy Aloe.

content.content:
[]>icy-aloe:This your first concert? <ap>In a while, you mentioned?
[]>capra:I haven't been to much so far. I hope I don't bother you with this.
[]>starry:Not at all!
[]>narrator:Before you get a chance to respond, the barkeep orders you up. <mp>Starry steps forward and looks back with a glance across the three of you.
[]>rider:Beer.
[]>narrator:Icy nods.
[]>icy-aloe:Beer too.
[]>starry:Three beers and one water then.

[]>narrator:They motion with their fingers.
[]>starry:Two beers. One soda. One water.

[]>narrator:The barkeep brings out your drinks and Rider raises his bottle for a toast.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|excited,icy-aloe-emotion|smug}:A beer most pleasing, to Doszbian ceasing.
[]>icy-aloe:To Doszbian ceasing.
[]>narrator:You clink bottles.
[]>rider:I wish Para could be here.
[]>starry:You did invite them though, didn't you?
[]>rider:Well as you can see he's nowhere to be found.
[]>icy-aloe:Para- <ap> another friend of ours. Always on the move though.
[]>rider:Just like you.
[]>starry:Yea, you two are almost identical in that regard.
[]>icy-aloe:But I'm not as bad as Para. It's always gone for weeks.
[]>rider:You might as well be too.
[]>starry:Exactly. You just roam within like two cities, not several countries.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|smug}:Can't help it.
[]>starry:Lets not stay right in the middle of the bar, guys.
[]>narrator:You all take a step to the sidelines.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I think I could do that pretty well. <mp>Disappearing for weeks on end. Honestly, I already do.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:That shut in, huh?
[]>capra:Kinda...
[]>narrator:As Rider takes a sip from his beer, you realize you haven't drank anything yet. You tip your <func:got_beverage> to your lips.

[]>rider:Didn't even know they sold FuzzOrange here.
[]>capra:I didn't know what else to get. This seemed good.
[]>rider:It's hella sweet.
[]>icy-aloe:Good though.
[]>starry:Only if you're into rotten teeth.
[]>icy-aloe:Toothbrushes.

[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Is that like a vampire thing?
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|serious}:What is?
[]>rider:The whole depression thing.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated}:Para always makes the same jokes.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Now I kinda want to meet them.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Partly, right, Capra?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Huh?
[]>icy-aloe{rider-emotion|neutral}:For me it never lasts very long.
[]>capra:It can get pretty bad. Especially if you don't do anything to combat the symptoms.
[]>starry:True.
[]>rider:Can you all not talk in riddles now?
[]>starry:Vampy talk too much for you, Rider?
[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated}:No I just have no idea what any of you are talking about.
[]>starry:It's easy. You lack what you need, you fucking die.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Or you try to, at least.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|serious}:Yes.<lc>Vampirism can bring a lot of irritability and such with it when you get malnourished or exposed to the sun too much.
[]>starry:Lethal case of hangry.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Of... what?
[]>starry:Hungry-angry.
[]>rider:Just don't you all die on me.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:We try not to.

[]>icy-aloe:But yes. First time to a hardcore concert?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Yes.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I really don't know what to expect.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Well... Lots of heavy music I'd say.
[]>starry:Truly the best summary.
[]>rider:You give a better one.
[]>starry:How about no?
[]>icy-aloe:I've been waiting to see Nailbiter for two years now, I can't wait.
[]>rider:The last time would have been before I moved here. Insane.
[]>icy-aloe:That was such a messed up move.
[]>starry:Hey guys. It's not that comfortable down here because there's so many people moving around us. <mp>Do we maybe wanna get back up to the floor?
[]>icy-aloe:Sure.
[]>narrator:Each with half-drank bottle in hand, you head up from the bar.

[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:It'll start soon.
[]>narrator:The band is already setting up on stage. <lc>The hall is darkly-lit, and stuffed to the brim. Random people keep bumping into you. <mp>You try to stay close to the others.

[]>rider{rider-emotion|excited}:Sound check! Let's fucking goooo!
[]>narrator:In unison, the three turn to the stage.

[]>starry:By the way, things will get rowdy but no need to be afraid. You can just stick with me.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I'm not looking forward to it.
[]>narrator:Before Starry can answer, the band has already started playing.

[]>narrator:Grime goes hard.<lc>Icy Aloe and Rider both snap back and forth with the rumbling bass of the percussion.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Hhg.
[]>narrator:Don't choke on your anxiety.
[]>capra:I'll just focus on the band. And focus on the lights. And the music.
[]>narrator:You are basically frozen in place. <lc>And you remain like this. <mp>And remain. <mp>And remain.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Starry taps you on your shoulder.
[]>narrator:It's too loud to make out their words, but a questioning look and a hand going from thumbs-up to thumbs-down, back and forth, makes the question clear.<lc>You politely shrug and nod.<lc>They give you a thumbs up and a smile back. <mp>Then you turn back to face the stage. <lc>The overhead lights are bright enough to blind you whenever they shine near your sensitive eyes.
[]>narrator:...
[]>narrator:You end up closing them for a good chunk of the set.

[]>narrator:Break time.
[]>starry:Everything alright there?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:You don't need to worry about me.
[]>starry:Knowing if you're unwell is important though! <mp>Please let me know if you want to go take a break or anything.
[]>capra:Sure.
[]>narrator{rider-emotion|excited}:Rider and Icy turn back around.
[]>icy-aloe:Good music.
[]>starry:Truly.
[]>capra:Is it important that the other two have gone off without telling us where?
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:They'll be fine. It's too packed to look for them anyways.
[]>icy-aloe:We'll just meet them outside after the concert.

[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|smug}:We're gonna head into the pit with Nailbiter. <mp>You gotta join us.
[]>capra:I don't think that's for me. Sorry.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Fine, too.
[]>narrator:And then it already starts again.

[]>narrator:And then it's time for the main act. Icy dives back into the mosh pit area as Nailbiter make their way onto the stage. <ap>Rider follows suit, and then it's just Starry and you, surrounded by the other concertgoers that are all a bit too shy to go to the front, but still want to be close enough to feel the motion of the room.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Still a bit much.
[]>narrator:Starry probably cannot hear you. It's pretty loud. <lc>And then it gets louder.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:The music now is even louder. Nailbiter's set shreds. <ap>Hard.

[]>narrator:The opening song pulls in half of the venue into a massive mosh pit in the center, including Rider and Icy Aloe. 
[]>narrator:Your ears hurt within two songs. <mp>Is there something you could do against that? <mp>It seems the others are just... <ap> Living with it. <lc>A few crodsurfers start riding overhead. You're glad you're off enough to the sidelines to not have to carry them. You're unsure if you even could. <lc>Eventually, there's a small break and you still only see Starry around, right next to you.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>narrator:A solitary thought burrows itself in the forefront of your mind!
[]>capra:What if we don't find the others after this?
[]>starry:Huh?
[]>narrator:You inhale. <mp>And struggling to keep up the lessons from your voice training, you shout as loud as possible again.
[]>capra:WHAT IF WE DON'T FIND THE OTHERS AFTER THIS?
[]>starry:OUTSIDE. AFTER THE SET.
[]>narrator:They give a thumbs up gesture.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:This is so exhausting.
[]>starry:Huh?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Nothing.
[]>narrator:And then the next song plays. The entire room is shaking, more and more people converging in the center, pushing Starry and you further and further back until you can barely see the stage anymore. You're almost back at the steps down to the bar. <lc>For a crescendo of strobe lights and blastbeats, the vocalist splits the crowd in two.<lc>Worriedly, you look up at Starry. <mp>Their expression is calm. Their gaze, unfaltering. <lc>And then the crowd crashes into one another. <mp>You whince at the sight of the sheer mass of flesh colliding. <mp>It looks disgusting.
[]>narrator:Eventually, after an encore of two songs, spanning almost 10 more minutes, the stage techs emerge and start deconstructing the stage.
[]>narrator:It is only now, that the two pit-goers reemerge.

[]>starry:I think they'll kick us out in a few minutes. Angel and Crosscull are probably also waiting for us, if they haven't left yet.
[]>icy-aloe:True.
[]>rider:Well then let's go.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Uh wait. Where have you two even been?
[]>rider:We just talked to a few people here.
[]>narrator:Girders and amplifiers get moved about around you.
[]>starry:Yeah, we really need to bounce.
[]>narrator: With Starry leading the way, the four of you head towards the exit.
[]>narrator:As you depart and walk through the entryway, Rider falls back to you.

[]>rider:There's another concert like this one happening in a few days. It's right on Christmas actually, if you don't have anything better to do then.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:...<ap>...<lc>Uhm...
[]>narrator:This spontaneity is way too much for you.
[]>capra:I'll... think on it. I'll text you.
[]>rider:Gotcha.
[]>narrator:And then, you're already outside.
