[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral,angel-emotion|neutral}:Uhh... hi.

[]>narrator:They turn to face you. A tensing shiver runs across your shoulders.
[]>angel:Hi! I don't think we met before?
[]>capra:Uhh... no. I'm- I'm from the hot sauce enjoyers server, Icy invited me when we were going over some theory. <ap>It was a few days ago.
[]>angel:Oohhh yea, the KommKomm server.
[]>capra: ...yea. Rider posted the link and it was an open invitation so...
[]>angel: Awww well hello, I'm happy to have you then. I'm Angel and terrible at screen names, what's your name?
[]>capra: ... <lc> ...Capra.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:Nice to meet you Capra!
[]>crosscull: Hello. I'm Crosscull. Xe/xer.
[]>capra: Likewise. <mp> The meeting part, my pronouns are a bit fucked. But uhh I think she/her for me for now.
[]>angel: Ah yes, I recall you talking about that in the vent channel. So your gender is still doing its thing?
[]>capra: Heh. I don't know. I dunno. Honestly.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}: That's totally fine. Don't need to turn this into group therapy immediately haha.
[]>crosscull: [affirmative noise]

[]>narrator:They turn towards you. You have trouble recalling whose screen names correspond to who.
[]>angel:Hi! I don't think we met irl before?
[]>capra:Heh, no... I was just there when you talked about this, and one of you invited me.
[]>angel:Capra, right?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Uhh... yes?
[]>angel:Yes, remembered correctly. <mp>I should really start using my actual name online too.
[]>crosscull:Maybe not.
[]>crosscull:Hello, by the way.
[]>capra:Hi.

[]>angel: So how much are you looking forward to this? Have you been to many concerts recently, or in life in general?
[]>capra: To be honesty, not really. No, I don't even go outside much. But I'm hoping this to turn well.
[]>crosscull: Is this music to your tastes?
[]>capra: I don't know. I don't listen to much heavy stuff like this.
[]>angel: Haha, well, Grime and Nailbiter both go hard as fuck. But we also only know of them since a show a few months back. I don't think we organized that over KommKomm though.
[]>crosscull: To mention, we have different favorites.
[]>angel: Very true. I'm more into the harsh riffs of Nailbiter. Crosscull is more into the bassy sludge of Grime.
[]>crosscull: Yes. It comes with my background in the darkwave and industrial scene.
[]>capra: Haha, you know your stuff around this stuff?
[]>angel: You could say that. It mostly comes with exposure though. There's no formal academies on dark and heavy music.

[]>narrator: The distorsion of the sound check crushes the air around you.
[]>angel: Speaking of which, did you bring hearing protection?
[]>capra: I didn't know I'd need some.
[]>angel: Oh yes, HC shows can get super loud. I have some single-use plugs on me, you can use those if you want.
[]>capra: Eh, it's fine.<lc>...<lc>Also... <ap>What's HC?
[]>angel:Oh, just hardcore. Y'know, the music.
[]>capra:Yes, I see.
[]>angel: Okay, just let me know if you think you need plugs after all.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:This is exciting.
[]>narrator:Crosscull and Angel turn towards the stage. Grime has come up and immediately the lights dim and you see nothing but the stage illuminated. Uncertainty makes your heart race. Angel and Crosscull exchange glances of anticipation at the show.

[]>narrator: The music is- thumpy. Sludgy, Angel would probably call it. You feel the bass in your bones, and even though you assume there are words are coming from the vocalist's mouth, you don't understand a single one. Are you even supposed to? <ap> No one else seems to mind.

[]>narrator:After a few songs, Crosscull vanishes into the crowd. Xer tall stature occasionally emerges from the edges of the mosh pit. <mp>You barely move an inch.<lc>The bright lights and harsh noise keep your brain occupied.<lc>Angel seems to be enjoying herself, moving along with the music in small body movements. She occasionally sends you a glance. You mostly shy away from those. <lc> The crowd is rowdy, you cannot bear to have these people bump into you continuously. <mp>This is a literal hellscape. <ap>You should leave, and tell them you died- <ap>And- <ap>...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Silence, brain. For once.
[]>narrator:After about an hour, the lights come back on.
[]>narrator: Angel turns to the crowd, trying to spot Crosscull. Xe's surprisingly difficult to identify, despite the tall body and metal mask.

[]>narrator:When xe comes back, you immediately feel the adrenaline spike in your veins.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Sorry, I gotta go to the bathroom.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|consoling}: Is everything alright?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}: Yeah.
[]>narrator: It's not really a response but you put a mental checkmark on it.
[]>angel: Awesome. Just let Crosscull or me know if you get uncomfortable during the show.
[]>crosscull: Please do.
[]>capra: I will.
[]>narrator: Crosscull turns to Angel.
[]>crosscull: That pit was quite good. I think you'll enjoy it.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:And no shirtless assholes so far!
[]>crosscull: Quite true.
[]>narrator: The conversation shifts back to the concert, and eventually, the venue.

[]>angel: ...Another thing I also love about this place is how naturally people are about the whole vampire thing. They know we won't randomly kill them. And if you ever need some vegan blood, they have Artihem capsules at the bar too.
[]>capra: Oh, that's nice to know. I've- uhhh- I've always just suffered with the thirst symptoms. Haha.
[]>angel: And you're still standing!
[]>crosscull: Unhealthy though. Let us know if you need some patching up.
[]>capra: Thank you. I'll manage for now.

[]>angel: Alright, Nailbiter is coming up, I'm gonna get in that pit.
[]>narrator: They quickly hug each other.
[]>crosscull: I'll rest for now. Take care.
[]>narrator: Angel offers you the same gesture. You weakly accept. Your skin feels like it's getting flayed.
[]>capra: Have fun.

[]>narrator:This time, the music is even harsher, shrill and distorted quitar noises piercing your ear drums, and the mosh pit growing even larger. Maybe to two or three times its size during Grime. You take a step back. Crosscull steps back with you, occasionally stepping in front of you to push a rogue pit participant back to where they belong. <lc> A few times, you fear for your life as a handful of crowdsurfers pass next to you. <mp>You always step out of the way.

[]>narrator:Eventually, you find yourself at the very edge of the crowd, barely seeing the band anymore with this sharp of an angle to the stage, but you don't mind. You never felt that music anyways.<lc>Angel stayed in the center, presumably now also moshing.<lc>Eventually, the vocalist draws the crowd's attention and splits it down the middle. <mp>The crowd gets even more compressed, and you wish you knew how to get out of this. Crosscull is pressed right up to you. <mp>Then, at the height of the song, the crowd rushes into the middle, crashing into one another. You have a hard time resisting the pull as you are still too close to the center, surprisingly.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Your heart rate is through the roof.
[]>narrator:Crosscull is standing tall irregardless. <mp> Bodies smashing into each other, guitars that sound like angle grinders, and vocal performances like murder victims- <ap>This is a place of intimidating violence to you. <mp>And eventually, after an encore from the band and an even further retreat away from the crowd from you, it is over.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}: That was AWESOME!
[]>crosscull: Absolutely.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}: Looks like you had fun.
[]>angel: Very much. Nailbiter are so fucking good. <lc> I hope you were also fine with the noise and everything?
[]>capra: Yes, no worries.
[]>angel: Okay good, because you did go quite the bit back. Pit went insane. Even pulled off a wall of death.
[]>narrator: Angel takes a few breaths.
[]>angel: ...<lc>......<lc>Wanna get something to drink?
[]>capra: Uhh... Yea. Sure.
[]>angel: Cool. Want anything?
[]>capra: Umm. Water is fine, if you want.
[]>angel: Gotcha.
[]>narrator: You step over to the bar, Angel orders three bottles of water, and you each step outside with the rest of the slowly-dispersing crowd, beverages in hand.

[]>angel: Ahhh... Haha. By the way, do you have anything planned on christmas?
[]>capra: <func:christmas_plans>
[]>angel: Ah okay. Because CC and I are gonna go to one of the local queer clubs that evening and we wanted to ask if you wanted to tag along.
[]>crosscull:Citrine, if you want to search for it.
[]>capra: I'll think on it.
[]>angel: Great.
[]>crosscull: Mh-hm.
[]>narrator: You continue with a bit of idle chit chat about that bar, this concert venue, all the things Angel and Crosscull appearently get up to regularly. <lc> A few solid minutes pass like this. <ap>Eventually, the others also exit the venue.
[]>narrator:Angel and Crosscull are already outside.

[]>angel:That pit was so good.
[]>rider:It was!

[]>icy-aloe:I think you were there too, Angel. <ap>I scraped my knee in that Nailbiter pit.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:I saw! And some of those guys didn't even help you back up?
[]>icy-aloe:Can't all be winners.
[]>crosscull:Icy. Are you fine?
[]>icy-aloe:Yes. <mp>It was very fun too. Anticipation is building already again anyways. Nuclear Infanticide in a week!
[]>rider{rider-emotion|excited}:Nuclear Infanticide in a week!!
[]>angel:Are they headlining?
[]>rider:Yep!
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Honestly, then I'm not as sad that I'm not going.
[]>icy-aloe:Why?
[]>rider:Their music kicks ass!
[]>angel{angel-emotion|sad}: Okay, I quickly need to talk about the name then. Barely 5 generations ago, we literally had hospitals nuked. I have cousins back home that are still being affected by it. I really don't like the name.
[]>icy-aloe:But isn't it also meant as anti-war shock naming?
[]>angel{rider-emotion|neutral,icy-aloe-emotion|neutral,angel-emotion|sad}:It's just a very typical brand of white activism that counts on shock value rather than talking to victims. <lc>And I'd rather not be reminded of how one of my communities got mutilated by- <ap>Well, <ap>imperialist and capitalist interests.
[]>icy-aloe: Serious... damn.
[]>starry{starry-emotion|sad}: True. I sympathize with that. <mp>I think I'm too brainrotted and nihilistic to care. <mp>But I definitely agree for people that aren't me.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|sad}:Feel free to go, of course. I just wouldn't feel comfortable if I were there.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:So I don't.

[]>starry{starry-emotion|neutral}:What are you doing there again?
[]>angel:We'll be going to Citrine!
[]>crosscull:End-of-year party season kicks off then. <mp>Organized by a friend's mother.
[]>rider:Didn't I meet her once?
[]>crosscull:At the move?
[]>rider:Yea, the milfy one!
[]>narrator{icy-aloe-emotion|serious,angel-emotion|neutral,capra-emotion|spiraling,rider-emotion|excited}:A wave of abject horror and held-back laughter crashes through the group.
[]>starry:Bwaha.
[]>crosscull:...
[]>angel:...
[]>capra:Umm...
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Uhh...
[]>starry:Great move.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Yea, that one.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|excited}:Then you better have fun for the five- <ap>six of us, you two!
[]>crosscull:That we will.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>capra:Hey uhh... I'm sorry if this interrupts but it's getting kinda cold, to be honest.
[]>crosscull: It's getting late too.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:It's getting quite late indeed. It's been an absolute pleasure hanging out with you, Capra.
[]>capra: H- huh? <ap>Thank you, yes, same.
[]>starry:Very true.

[]>angel: Will you be fine going home on your own? Where do you even live?
[]>capra: Uhhmm, east. In Galwice.
[]>crosscull: Then I can accompany you. I also live in that direction.
[]>angel: Lovely! Is that fine with you?
[]>capra: Yes, of course.
[]>angel: Then that's settled. Great! Have a safe ride home you two.
[]>crosscull: Likewise. We will be in touch.
[]>angel: That we will! Bye!
[]>capra: Bye everyone.
[]>starry:Get home safely!

[]>narrator:The ride home is uneventful. With Angel gone, the conversation is much less lively, but Crosscull doesn't seem to mind. Xe almost enjoys that silence, it seems. Or maybe xe just hates you. Regardless, Crosscull gets out a few stops before you, you say your goodbyes. <lc>Later that evening, there's some activity on the KommKomm server.

[]>narrator:The ride home is uneventful. You don't know Crosscull, and you're collapsing from social anxiety. It is very quiet between you two. But Crosscull doesn't seem to mind. Xe almost enjoys that silence, it seems. Or maybe xe just hates you. Regardless, Crosscull gets out a few stops before you, you say your goodbyes.
[]>narrator:Later that evening, there's some activity on the KommKomm server. A voice call with Icy, Rider, and one name you don't recognize.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Go outside instead. Enough socializing for today.

content.content:
[]>icy-aloe:Capra! So we meet again.
[]>capra:Hi... hi.
[]>rider: Also can't sleep, huh?
[]>capra: Do you also have trouble sleeping?
[]>rider: Yep. that's how it is with insomnia.
[]>capra: I dont know if I have insomnia... But my sleeping schedule is also pretty messed up.
[]>capra:Uh huh.
[]>rider:Yea, Para, we got a new one. She also lives here and was with us at the concert.
[]>para:Heya.

[]>icy-aloe:Did you enjoy your time at the concert?
[]>capra:It was... <ap>okay.
[]>narrator:The road to making friends sucks ass.
[]>icy-aloe:People coming and going in and out of pits is normal. At least we all ended up back together.
[]>capra:It was more so the music. I'm still mixed on it.

[]>rider:We didn't even really get to hang out afterwards much. <lc>How about you join us then again?
[]>capra:I'll think on it. It's quite something to meet this many new people suddenly. <ap>And... <ap>The music isn't really my thing either.
[]>icy-aloe:But Angel and CC are so sweet, aren't they?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I guess.
[]>rider:Just let us know if you wanna tag along.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:...

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:You're.. I think... the only people I know in Helenia.
[]>rider:That's fucked up. <lc>Where did you come from?
[]>capra:Nowhere.
[]>rider:...
[]>icy-aloe:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I grew up online.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Those were good times, to be honest. I really like the internet.
[]>icy-aloe:We all do.
[]>capra:But I lived in it, you know? It's just getting eroded as a third place now. As a place to hang out and... <mp>Sorry.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I was born here and never left.
[]>icy-aloe:Glad to be meeting you then.
[]>capra:I kinda have to get out. Doomscrolling all day and also during my deadend day job... I don't like it.
[]>rider:Also been there... online. Years ago.
[]>narrator:It's 3:35 AM. The night sky is calling you.
[]>capra:I'm gonna go out for a walk now.
[]>rider:At this god damn hour?
[]>capra:I like the night. 
[]>narrator:That's a vampire thing. <lc>And a former-neet thing.
[]>rider:Well, have fun Capra.
[]>icy-aloe:Stay safe!
[]>para:Oh wait! <mp>Are you also a vampire?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>para:Because if so that's really cool and we should definitely hang out.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Yeah... Maybe we should.
[]>capra:Bye.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm so done. I have such a headache.
[]>narrator:Better not to push it.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I'm just gonna go outside. I think.
[]>narrator:After idling around for a few more minutes, you follow through on that.

[]>narrator:You're often awake at night. <mp>Your four walls are safe as they are suffocating, and the solitude of the night forest, with its coniferous odor and space void of social interaction, presents itself as the most perfect way out.<lc> The soundscape of nocturnal birds and the insects they hunt fills the air, and a clear sky blankets you overhead.<lc>It is nights like these, that make you run on two hours of sleep a day during the work week and sleep all day on the weekends.<lc>It is the greatest experience you have ever known.
[]>narrator:It is also nights like these, where you let your brain air out, and just mumble talk to yourself about whatever happens to cross your mind. <lc>They usually aren't pretty things.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:There's such a sadness in my heart...<lc>What if I can't hang myself when the time comes? Just too many negative thoughts weighing down my head. Snapping the tree.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:...Let's kill more nature, shall we? Not like we don't have a new ecological disaster every few weeks anyways.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I really need to start writing these depressive episodes down. I aways get so poetic. But it'd also be really pathetic.
[]>narrator:Do not believe you are more than your suffering.
[]>capra:I live to suffer. <lc>And I don't even document it like the worthless refuse I am.
[]>narrator:And that reminds you:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Ah my god, I keep forgetting the mood diary. I think it has been two days without an entry again already. I'm so sorry miss therapist.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I- <ap>I need to snap out of this.
[]>narrator:And you bolt off.
[]>narrator:You run home and out of breath from being out of shape and without a lick of muscle, you close the door behind you.
[]>narrator:And then you collapse into your bed.

[]>narrator:The next days pass without fanfare. As usual, you awake, drag yourself out of bed and ride the bus to work enshrouded against the sunlight, get weird stares for it, and plop down on your bed face down and full of sadness. <lc> Sometimes, you write a bit.
[]>narrator:You write about how your are haunted and scared, and then delete the drafts again because no one would believe you.
[]>narrator:You write about your recent depressive bouts.<lc>And now the concert compelled you into nature, much like an anxiety attack.
[]>narrator:You write about your yearning desire to find a real place to belong.
[]>narrator:About how you made a promise to yourself.
[]>narrator:About the universe itself compelling you to go out and find others.
[]>narrator:About how not even your therapist knows about your vampirism in the first place. <lc>Your massive distrust in the medical and psychiatry system.

[]>narrator:You write about life. <lc>And it always, always, finds itself discarded and never-looked at again. <lc>You envy those that can turn their suffering into art. <mp>You only turn it into self-destructive urges.

[]>narrator:And then, finally, the weekend arrives. <mp>You wake up and the sky is tinted in a gentle and delightful shade of rose. Up and above, you let your gaze wander, and it becomes a lovely grey-blue, resting atop the world. You want to get up, and see the world in its glory, take in these hues, and let your mind create a wonderful world in your head. <lc>But you don't. <mp>You're depressed. <mp>You lie there, catatonically, and the guilt of not going out there instantly starts gnawing at your moral marrow. <lc>As you wait for the waves of death to wash over you, the sun continues its climb into the sky. <ap>So your blackout curtains go in front of it.

[]>narrator:The new day eventually ages into early noon and your impulsive tendencies finally get to you. <mp>Pure muscle memory guiding you, you drag your feet over to your PC, and boot it up. It must have been years since that was not the first thing you do on a weekend after getting up.

[]>narrator:And just as the whirring of the fans is now filling the silcene of your apartment, so too is the brutality of the world echoing through your screens.
[]>doomfeed:"This week saw an escalation of violence across southern Doszbian."
[]>narrator:That's where you live, by the way.
[]>doomfeed:"Within the last week, a consistent spike across the region in reported assaults was noted by law enforcement."
[]>narrator:You switch over to another news source. <ap>A more local one.
[]>doomfeed:"Allegedly, the assaults and batteries are targeted at vampires. Of the 14 attacked, 5 of which are still in the ICU, 8 and 3 respectively were confirmed to be vampires themselves, or associates thereof."
[]>narrator:It goes on like this...

[]>narrator:Some months ago, you joined a KommKomm server. The same platform all your online friends are on. <lc>But in this instance, you got the invitation though a local forum. <mp>You didn't go there after the second hangout.
[]>narrator:As the sun sets, there's still life on the KommKomm server. Nothing evades your gaze. And almost nothing evades your apathy either. <mp>Almost nothing.

[]>narrator:This server is a fairly local thing. You joined it at some point <ap>(like everything, <ap>you can't remember when), <ap>and have not sent much in it besides the mandatory intro text and a few messages in the vent channels.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:The spirit of all of vampires is coming for me... <ap>I'll show it how awful this is.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I already want to kill myself again...
[]>narrator:But, with the liquid courage of quickly downing a few shots of booze to make you functional, you barrel into the voice chat at long last. <lc>And it only took five minutes.
[]>narrator:You promised yourself you'd be here when the next opportunity arose.<lc>This is now.
[]>narrator: It's Rider, hanging out in the voice chat, streaming to no one but Icy.

[]>narrator:This is too much sociality for you. <mp>You went to a concert with them and then talked to them more- <ap>Live. <ap>In a voice call. <lc>You feel like your brain will implode if you talk to any more people right now. <lc>And so you find yourself back in solitude, and browsing online.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Join the voice call. Watch the stream. Interact.
Time to wrap up the evening.
Time to wrap up the evening.

content.content: []>narrator:It might be good to do a followup to the concert. Better this than rotting with depression all weekend again.
[]>narrator:You will not sit on the sidelines forever.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Eldritch horrors are now coming for me already. <mp>This is hell.
[]>capra:I will be told what to do. Just this once.
[]>narrator:And with the determination of a hostage to fate, you navigate your mouse into the voice chat menu, and click 'join'.

[]>rider: Ayo.
[]>capra: Hi...
[]>rider: We haven't met before, right?
[]>narrator: This was SUCH a big mistake.
[]>capra: Yea... I mean no. Well, We haven't. 
[]>rider: Gotcha.<lc>Who are you?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Uhhh... Capra. I joined here some time ago because I saw the invite link around my area.
[]>icy-aloe:Also, we talked recently!

[]>icy-aloe:Had a nice little chat about the state of things. And the server and the community center.
[]>rider:The community center?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'm... umm... <mp>Kinda from here.
[]>icy-aloe:Just general leftism and stuff.

[]>icy-aloe:Getting another one introduced to anti-psychiatry.
[]>narrator:There's a really smug tone in their voice.
[]>rider:Fucking awesome.

[]>rider:Did you just join?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:No. Like I said, a while back. <ap>...<ap>Just took a while to work up courage to call with someone here.
[]>rider: Okay, I'm Rider. I do a bunch of shit around here. <lc>We were at a concert with friends yesterday!
[]>capra: What kind of concert?
[]>rider:You probably don't know the bands, but we also didn't. It was doomed hardcore.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Uh huh.
[]>rider:Not that familiar with it? 
[]>capra: Not really. Sorry if this is too much, but what is that?
[]>rider: Oh just music. Thick and thumpy and loud, that kinda shit.
[]>capra:That's really not my thing.
[]>icy-aloe:What type of music do you listen to?
[]>capra:If I'm honest, not much. Not really.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Mostly video game music.
[]>icy-aloe:Are you big into games, too?
[]>capra:You could say that.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:I really like speedrunning.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Weird, I know.
[]>icy-aloe:But super cool!
[]>rider:We don't game much these days anymore.
[]>icy-aloe:Way more outgoing, concerts, and stuff.
[]>rider:So you catching me stream a game is actually such a rarity.
[]>rider:Gonna be going to a concert on Christmas on all days for fuck's sake. Kinda funny. You also wouldn't like it, Capra. The headliner band is called Nuclear Infanticide.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:That sounds gruesome. That really doesn't sound like something for me.

[]>rider:Hi there.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:... Hi.
[]>icy-aloe:Capra! Welcome back! <mp>Did you have good travels home with Crosscull?
[]>capra:Why wouldn't I?
[]>icy-aloe:Oh no reason. I just ask in case there's something bad I am not aware of.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Oh... okay...<ap> Not, I'm fine.
[]>rider:Sick.
[]>rider:Also, we talked about another concert, or the headliner's name at least, at the Nailbiter show. It's kinda brutal but feel free to come along.
[]>icy-aloe:I can send you a link just in case.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:...<mp> Sure.
[]>narrator:This might be going too fast for you.
[]>rider:If it's not your music taste, you don't have to come along.
[]>icy-aloe:But you're still welcome to.
[]>narrator:Maybe that'll be you way out to skip that evening.

[]>rider:Yea it's like death metal and stuff.
[]>icy-aloe:But as with all things everyone one this server is invited, just let the rest know beforehand.
[]>capra:[center]I yearn for connection.[/center]

[]>capra:Could I come with?
[]>rider:When I tell you about a concert that's already me being fine with you being there. Besides, not like that matters anyhow. Just... fucking come along if you want!<lc>...<lc>Hell yea.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Okay... I'll think on it.
[]>capra:Nuclear infanticide... what a name. I'll think on it.

[]>rider:Also, hop in the stream Capra-<mp> This will be my last match for today but I'm kicking ass.
[]>narrator:You join the stream.

[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:...<mp> You know what's kinda funny?
[]>rider:What?
[]>capra:I played the same game for a few years.
[]>rider:YOU PLAY PACEBREAKER?
[]>capra:Not anymore. It got me into speedrunning, and that's what I do now, for the most part.
[]>rider:Doesn't PB have a speedrunning community too?
[]>capra:I started with PBSR, I just run other games now, or watch others.
[]>icy-aloe:It is like once every half year when Rider and I actually have enough time to play some rounds. If you want, we can try and organize something like that again.
[]>capra:Maybe, but you don't need to make space for me in your calendars.
[]>icy-aloe:With three people we could actually do a full stack.
[]>rider:That would be sick.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Can I backseat for just one bit?
[]>rider:Go ahead.
[]>capra:They might have patched it out but there was a time where you could slingshot yourself across the map with the ramp down there to your right and a double grav frag.
[]>rider:Huh?
[]>capra:Sigh... Equip frags and switch to grav abilities, drop two of them in that crevice and then you should glitch across the diagonal geometry across the map. <mp>Leaves you with a sliver of health and you have insane angles for a solid three seconds.
[]>rider:That's some insane pro shit... I can't do that.
[]>icy-aloe:Can't hurt to try. I want to see this.
[]>rider:Fine...
[]>narrator:Rider follows your lead, and blows himself up twice before getting a small boost. It works on the fourth try.
[]>rider:OKAY THAT MOTHERFUCKING RULES.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:That's one of the few things I can actually keep in my memory. Gaming tricks and glitches and their OSTs.
[]>icy-aloe:That's very fun.
[]>narrator:Eventually, the match concludes, with Rider in the mid field of the scoreboard.
[]>rider:GG you two. We gotta fucking play now.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Maybe...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I tried playing it again a few days ago, and that went--- not that great. <mp>I might just be too out of it now.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I didn't play it in years though...

[]>capra:I don't think it would be very fun.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Sorry.
[]>rider:We're also not ultra gamers.
[]>icy-aloe:Maybe at some point.
[]>rider:Well, it's getting late and Starry forgot to leave some dinner for me.

[]>capra:Oh no, I'm sorry.
[]>rider:Can't all be winners.

[]>capra:Oh no, I'm sorry. <mp> I don't know who Starry is but no dinner is not good, I think.
[]>rider:They're just my roommate.

[]>rider:But it's fine. Just gonna chow down on some instant noodles.
[]>capra:I also like those.
[]>icy-aloe:Got the health squad over here.
[]>rider:It's good. <mp>Anyways, bye!
[]>capra:Bye.
[]>icy-aloe:I'll also head to bed now. Talk to you later!
[]>narrator:It's difficult to grasp you could just finally be somewhere.
[]>narrator:[center]On Desire.[/center]

[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Sorry, what was your name again?
[]>metaspirit:Those that can see me started calling me Metaspirit of Vampires about three decades ago.
[]>capra:But is that what you are called? - What you want to be called?
[]>metaspirit: I don't have a name.
[]>capra: Uhmm... <lc> If this isn't too intrusive, would you want us to look for one for you?
[]>metaspirit: I do not care.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>capra: Weird. But okay.

[]>metaspirit:I would like another matter discussed, however. <ap>One much more pertinent. <mp>There's the possibility, not the certainty, but a possibility that you will need to make some difficult choices in the future.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Huh? <ap>Would you please elaborate?
[]>metaspirit:You can bind and manifest this form, this fragment to your heart. And when you do, you must have a guiding vector. <ap>Capra. You are required to know who you are. Why you are.<lc>What do you use to inform your choices?

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Whatever disturbs me least, I guess. <mp>I'm sorry to say I don't have many aspirations besides not suffering.
[]>metaspirit:Pain avoidance...
[]>capra:Kind of.
[]>metaspirit:The world will not be friendly to those that do not live for something.
[]>capra:The world already isn't very friendly to anyone, as far as I know.
[]>metaspirit:So when you draw upon this form before you, it will be in the image of suffering?
[]>capra:Leave if it annoys you. Then you can save us both the hassle.
[]>metaspirit:I have no choice in the matter.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Whatever will give me most joy. Headstrong optimism.
[]>metaspirit:It is difficult to believe.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I'll admit being clinically depressed is making it hard to do that on most days. <ap>But when you allow me to make an actual, informed decision, I'll only focus on what I gain from it.
[]>metaspirit:Then may you gain the world.
[]>capra:Sure.

[]>capra:I guess... I have my moral compass?
[]>metaspirit:Which is informed by?
[]>capra:What feels right, I guess?
[]>metaspirit:A blind hedonist...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Well... not really. I will do things that feel bad to me if I think they are correct for society. <mp>It's part of the reason why I would also never kill myself with a train or truck. That can scar people for life.
[]>metaspirit:So whose rules do you follow?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:What does it concern you?
[]>metaspirit:Binding this form with unsteady laws can have disastrous consequences.

[]>capra:...<lc>...<lc> So.<lc>You just said I can- <ap>just summon you?
[]>metaspirit: Incorrect.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Oh. Sorry.
[]>metaspirit:...
[]>capra:Please explain it to me again. <mp>I'm sorry for being this stupid.
[]>metaspirit: Your heart is just highly resonant with the cosmic lattice. It is how you can see me... <ap>inside your eyes as you put it.<lc>And when your heart desires it, and swings in unison with the oscillations of the lattice, and the shapeless metaspirit beyond this form is within reach in the vast cosmos, you find me.
[]>capra:And how often is this?
[]>metaspirit:With the intensity of your soul, Capra-<ap> very, very often.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Great.
[]>metaspirit:This is your soul, Capra. It merely is. And as I said, knowing the depth of it is a grand asset to have as a vampire.
[]>capra:Sure. <ap>I guess.
[]>metaspirit:I mean you no ill.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Please- <ap>Please leave...<ap>I'm about to cry.
[]>metaspirit:Rest well.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:This is all so fucking intense... <lc>What does any of this mean... <lc>I need answers, not more reasons to quit life.

[]>narrator:Your bury your face in your pillow. The stress is overwhelming, and your chest feels crushed with the weight of a thousand stars.
[]>capra:I just... <mp>Don't get it. I'm sorry, to whoever decided to make me see space horrors. <mp>I'm sorry for this and I'm sorry for getting raped, or whatever it is I'm getting punished for.

[]>narrator:With frayed nerves and raspy voice, you come to a few hours later.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:And now I need to piss... <lc>This existence is horrible.

[]>narrator:To finally, kill the evening once and for all, you doomscroll more.
[]>doomfeed:"Following a series of assaults that have now resulted in the death of at least one person, the government is looking into consequences and prevention. <mp>The de-fang bill aims to curtail showing of vampirism outside with the goal of reducing the number of targeted attacks."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I hate this.
[]>narrator:You scroll further, having the news of tragedy interspersed with adult content.
[]>yearnfarms:"Introducing, the catwolf, a new and exhilarating toy from us here, at XXYToys."
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:When you open the comments, the vibe is generally supportive.
[]>capra:Maybe I should really get into online sex work... <mp>I know I could do it.
[]>narrator:You'd just have to save up for such a precious silicone scuplture first.
[]>capra:Maybe. Some day.
[]>narrator:But the world continues to churn and turn.
[]>narrator:A trial that has gone on for 18 years is about to conclude. This goes back to when a series of decisions by the agricultural lobby caused the supplement prices for vampirism-related medication to skyrocket. It is rumored that one kid from your kindergarden back then died because of this. <ap>You never looked into it.
[]>doomfeed:"Almost two decades after the iron root shortage-"
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:At the fault of no one, of course.
[]>doomfeed:"The trial is now coming to an end. The Supreme Doszbian Court has found Hemotech to be party responsible for the incurred costs from medical costs of iron-deficiency-related emergencies that affected parts of the population in 2002. Affected members of vampiric populations that can prove their afflictions within the noted timeframe can be eligible for a payout equal to their hospital costs, but for no longer than a continuous three week period."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:So a big middle finger. How unsurprising. 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Not like it matters anyways.
[]>doomfeed:"Proponents of a harsher verdict criticize it for being 'An avoidance of contract', as the language used makes it almost impossible to even claim the ruled compensation, as comorbidities in vampiric mortality will often take precedent over lack of access to nutritional supplements."
[]>capra:I'm gonna go scroll through some videos, this is too depressing right now.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:As the late evening drags on, you receive a phone call. <ap>A deeply unpleasant noise that you always forget to mute. <mp>It's your dad.
[]>narrator:You never even looked at their text but that doesn't matter to him. <lc>He's possessive like that.
[]>narrator:Maybe the call with your mother was not enough?

[]>narrator:You should not look at the phone today. This will ruin you.
[]>capra:I know.
[]>narrator:Ignore him.
[]>capra:I will.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Do not pick up the phone.
Do. Not. Pick. Up. The. Phone.
This is your subconscious speaking, avoid this.
Exposing yourself to transphobia is not necessary.
Self-harm is so easy. Pick up.

content.content:
[]>dad{dad-emotion|phone}:[deadname], I hope you're doing well!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I am.
[]>dad:Oh I am so happy to hear that. Say, for christmas I'm making pasta salad again, like the good old times.

[]>capra:Nice.
[]>dad:I'm already looking forward to it, big boy.
[]>capra:Me too, dad.

[]>capra:I'd love to join you, but I don't plan on coming.
[]>dad:Momma told me. Are you fine out there?
[]>capra:I am.
[]>dad:What are you doing then? Surely not cooped up in your hut all alone?
[]>capra:I'm hanging out with friends.
[]>dad:Well that's also nice. Tell them my best wishes.
[]>capra:I will.
[]>dad:...
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:After 10 seconds that info too, has left your brain.

[]>dad:So how is work?
[]>capra:Oh you know, it is how it is. Getting by.
[]>dad:That's good. Mine is going to shit. This cocksucking asshole at work- he-
[]>capra:Dad I'm sorry I have to cut you off but I need to get going.
[]>dad:Oh of course.
[]>capra:Bye.

[]>dad:Then I wish you a merry christmas with your friends.
[]>capra:Will do-<ap> I mean thanks.
[]>dad:Maybe we'll hear each other on the holy evening, won't we?
[]>capra:Maybe. Bye.
[]>dad:Bye, my [deadname].

[]>dad:Then until christmas, young man.
[]>capra:Yep. <lc>Bye.

[]>narrator:The phone goes silent. <lc>You talk so little these days, you don't even know what he could want. <mp>Really, you're just waiting for the day when he finally cannot split you from the groups he so viciously hates anymore.
[]>narrator:Your dad is not one to call repeatedly, so just a few minutes later, you receive a text instead.

[]>dad{dad-emotion|text}:Hello. <ap>[deadname].<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<lc>This christmas, I thought of doing pasta salad again. Like in the good old times.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Just keep breathing,
[]>narrator:Behind a thin veil of nostalgia for a long-dead you, there is nothing. This is no question or anything.
[]>dad:I could pick you up at your nice new apartment. <mp>And then you can kill yourself.
[]>narrator:That's not what it says.
[]>dad:I could pick you up at your nice new apartment. And then you don't have to go by bus. <lc>Dad.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I've lived here for ages.
[]>narrator:Almost two years.
[]>capra:More than enough. <mp>It's not directed at me, I'll...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Oh sigh...
[]>narrator:Acknowledging within dissociation, you close the text.

[]>dad{dad-emotion|text}:Hello [deadname.].<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<ap>.<lc>This christmas, I am sad that you're not with us. I am doing pasta salad again. Like in the good old times.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Uh huh.
[]>narrator:Beyond dissociation, there is nothing.
[]>dad:I wish you a Merry Christmas. <lc>Dad.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Anything but this right now.
[]>narrator:You flip your phone on its screen and put it on the desk on the other side of the room.
[]>capra:Anything but this...

[]>narrator:As the phone screen goes black again, the conversation that just transpired leaves your brain again, and your self returns. <lc>Knowledge of his past and current politics not leave you unscarred...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:But they're nothing against some targeted dissociation.
[]>narrator:Your brain is fried. Exhausted and bleeding on the floor. Within a few days, your life has become so so much.

[]>narrator:This deserves an entry in your mood diary.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I keep forgetting this... Damn.
[]>narrator:You pick up a ball-point pen and scrawl on the next best paper surface. <mp>A carton, former prison of frozen pizza.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:"My parents can go fuck themselves. I do not wish to talk to my dad. It gives me fucking anxiety attacks."
[]>narrator:You cross out the swear.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Gotta be a good bean.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:"I need to look into... Artihem."<lc>"Angel mentioned it at the concert."

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:"I might be going positively insane. I think."
[]>narrator:You shift your eyes around. No Metaspirit in sight.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:"Overall, I'm doing fine. Or bad...<ap>I'm doing as usual."

[]>narrator:With tape and blind faith, you add it to the pile of loose papers and printouts that you call your mood diary. <lc>And then, at the blinding and harrowing sight of the sun starting to creep across the horizon line once more, you finally go to bed.

[]>narrator:You awake to icy winds blowing through your tilted window. The sky is already dressed in pale blue, which means it's already well past morning. <mp>A sense of foreboding and catastrophy envelops your heart and you accept the fate of your toes getting broken off by the frigid cold. <lc>It's christmas morning.
[]>capra:... <lc>*sigh*<lc>...<lc>...
[]>narrator:It goes on like this. <ap>Eyes directed at the ceiling, and the inertia of your soul chaining you down to your mattress.<lc>If you were the universe, time would cease its motion over and over, until you are spurred, like today as well, by the realization that it moves without relent around you after all.
[]>capra:...<lc>............<lc>....
[]>narrator: A crane of the neck and a roll of the head and your hazy eyes glance outside the window past the curtains. <lc>A bout of clouds is making its way across the horizon.
[]>capra: How pretty. I love you.
[]>narrator: The outside reciprocates by sending a lovely flock of migratory birds towards the sun. <mp>Your inner eye sees them all die and fall out of the sky. Harbinger of death.<lc>The birds continue flying.<lc>You erect your torso, and get up. <mp>When you check your phone, it is almost noon.
[]>narrator:You make some tea, and sit down. The sense of nothingness is overwhelming, your plans for the evening ever yet uncertain until you are within them.
[]>narrator:Christmas evening arrived faster than you were prepared for. It is late afternoon. <mp>You have to do something.
[]>narrator:You told you parents you'd come. <lc>Doesn't mean you have to.

[]>narrator:You cancelled on your parents. Not like you care much about them anyways. They might be hurt? <mp>You could do a surprise visit!
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:But what does it matter anyways? <ap>They are so irrelevant.

choices.choice_text.enabled: You told them you'd go. So go.

content.content: []>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Oh my god, kill me now. <ap>Can't my parents just fucking dissolve? <ap>And me too- <ap>Just end this family outright.

[]>narrator:Angel's offer to join her and Crosscull at the queer club is making your social anxiety as bad as it can get. People probably have sex there. Possibly even doing drugs. And worst of all, you don't know anyone but Angel and Crosscull and who can say if they'll have time to babysit you. Yea that's right, it wouldn't be hanging out, you'd just be a burden on them.

[]>narrator: Rider's offer to join them at another concert would give you a good excuse to not go to your parents' place. Assuming you want to explain to them that you don't want to visit them. <lc>All you have to endure for that is another two or three hours of standing there awkwardly while everyone's enjoying themselves. You'd only be in the way of the other concert-goers anyways.<lc>You could also always just not go anywhere. Cooped up in your room, like most holidays. It's not like this family shit matters to you anyways.
[]>narrator:Where will you go?

choices.choice_text.enabled: Go to the concert with Rider, Icy, and Starry.
Go to the bar with Angel and Crosscull.
Throw yourself into uncertainty, go to the concert Rider mentioned.

content.content:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I don't need. Others. No desire. <lc>Can all go fuck themselves.
[]>narrator:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Oops. No swearing in this household.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Sigh... so what now?

[]>narrator:A call. <mp>Your mom.
[]>mom{mom-emotion|phone}:Where are you? Did something happen to you?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:No, mom.
[]>mom:To think my own son would stand up his parents on christmas.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'm sorry.
[]>mom:Do you at least have an explanation?
[]>capra:I just didn't feel like going outside.
[]>mom:That takes the cake. Well I hope you are happy like that.
[]>capra:Thank you. <mp>Merry christmas.
[]>mom:To you too. Goodbye.
[]>capra:Bye.

[]>narrator:Telling you parents you'll be there on christmas and then not showing up. Great.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Not like it matters anyways.
[]>narrator:Maybe a little drink won't hurt now.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:It definitely won't.
[]>narrator:Vodka, tequila, rum, and cola all find their way into your glass, and then you find solace with your two-thirds-complete long island ice tea.
[]>capra:I'm doing mixology. <lc>Yay.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Yay indeed. <lc>Oh my god shut the fuck up. <lc>That's superrudeeee. <lc>Don't thay sat to myself.

[]>narrator:You set yourself down on your bed, face directed up at the ceiling. The sudden rush of numbness from the lack of food and excess of spirits in your body makes the deafening silence more bearable.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Can I overdonk- <ap>Overdose on vampy hormones? <mp>I don't- <ap>shouldn't do- <ap>try to do it.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Ugh.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:This is such... bullscap- <ap>bullcrab. <ap>Man...
[]>narrator:The apartment is making you irate. These walls are choking and crushing you now, like they do on every holiday.
[]>narrator:With struggle, you get up.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Hmmnhg...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Good.

[]>narrator:And within a hurry, you find yourself outside again. <mp>You can't remember when you put on your boots.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Welcome back nature. I'm sorry to bother you again, but you don't grade- <ap>grate my brains... <lc>I guess you do neither?
[]>capra:...
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:It is not a good day to be outside and alone. Nowhere is a good place for you right now.
[]>capra:It would be the perf- perfect plase...
[]>narrator:But the path to nowhere is not down a bottle.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:Then... where is it? <lc>I want to...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Nevermind.
[]>narrator:Your rumination keeps encoraching upon you, replayinging the past over and over. <lc>Flashes of gore and abuse just filter through your head at every turn, every day.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:What if I killed myself now... <lc>I doubt anyone would miss me.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:But that's'd - would be such a hassle.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Can't even pull that off right... <lc>Yesh, think productive thoughts.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:"Oh yea let's almost dislocate her shoulder, that'll make her into a functioning human being."
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:No, brain. The past is not a productive place.
[]>narrator:But they're your parents.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:And I fucking hate em. Theycannago-- <ap>DIE. <mp>In a ditch.
[]>narrator:Will you put them there yourself?
[]>capra:Unlikely. <lc>The less rent-free those--- <ap>They live in my head. <mp>The less they do that, the better. <lc>They can do that themselves. <lc>They should just off themselves.
[]>narrator:...
[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:...<lc>Good talk.
[]>narrator:The trees respond with nothing but silence.
[]>narrator:And eventually, you return home.
[]>narrator:[center]On Temporality and Premonition[/center]

[]>metaspirit:You are doing disastrously unwell.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:No shit.
[]>metaspirit:Where are your decisions evaluated?
[]>capra:Why must you be so cryptic?
[]>capra:Nowhere? <mp>The universe doesn't care.
[]>metaspirit:No, Capra. You are your own person. When do you decide to evaluate your choices?
[]>capra:The past.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:If you couldn't see by now, my life is too much for me. <mp>I just look at what was good in the past and... <ap>cling to that.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I've read a few things online that this might be more mentall illness.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:And I know you're also not supposed to compare yourself to others. <ap>Or your happier past self.<lc>But that's just how it is.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}: I regret some things.
[]>metaspirit{capra-emotion|anger}:I know.
[]>narrator:You stare daggers into its eyeless head.
[]>capra: And- <ap> And I don't want them to repeat. <lc>So I keep in mind what I can learn from the past and become better that way.
[]>metaspirit:...<lc>Beware of becoming eclipsed by your past.
[]>capra:As if there's anything else.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I see it quite pragmatically. Our past contextualizes our present decisions. <mp>So really, there is nothing to value- <ap>evaluate, I mean.
[]>metaspirit:Self-reified determinism.
[]>capra:Sure. I guess.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:To be honest, I don't know what any of those words mean.
[]>metaspirit:You see everything as a consequence of the past?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:And that past should've been made with the best intentions for everyone.
[]>metaspirit:And what if the past does not suffice?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I don't know.<lc>I give up, I guess.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I straight up do not care.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:About anything like that.
[]>capra:The past cannot be altered, the future is yet to be certain. The present is the only relevant thing.

[]>capra:I just follow my instincts and do what feels good in the moment.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:That's how I'm slowly but surely developing more and more substance abuse issues.

[]>capra:but as long as you minimize friction, it should never come up.
[]>metaspirit:but it can compound. just like your drug habits.
[]>capra:Then I'll kill myself when it comes back to haunt me.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I have all the info I need before me. The second I decide I'll reach the other side of that decision.
[]>metaspirit:Do you? <mp> And will you?
[]>capra:Do I what and will I what?
[]>metaspirit:Do you have all the information before you?
[]>capra:I know as much as possible.
[]>metaspirit:And that is objective?
[]>capra:I think so.
[]>metaspirit:It's the guise of objectivity. <mp>And even if it were absolute truth, will you get an answer as soon as you think of if your so-called objective decision was good?
[]>capra:According to how time works, yes.

[]>capra:The future.
[]>metaspirit:Quite typical for those with presentimental proclivities.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Yes, about that. <lc>What does that mean, exactly?
[]>metaspirit:It means you can see the future.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I can what? Sorry, but I don't believe you.
[]>metaspirit:It is not as you might think. <lc>Premonition does not equate omniscience. <mp>It just means that you may know the sequence of specific events, or fragmented motivators without knowing where they lead.<lc>What you speak can be what you manifest. Now, Capra:
[]>metaspirit:How do you think about the future?

[]>capra: There's one mental image I like to come back to over and over. It's kinda like this. 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Draw one point in the future out to the present. <ap>And burn away the rest.
[]>metaspirit:Aspirations-driven?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:If you want to put it that way.
[]>metaspirit:And what are your current ones?
[]>capra:My current what?
[]>metaspirit:Aspirations.
[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Okay I have to admit there's a lot of hate in me right now and not much else.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Eventually, I'd like to cease to be. Until then, I'll just focus on how much burden I can take away from my future self.
[]>metaspirit:And what are those burdens?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Right now? <mp>Living in a genocidal state. <mp>Having shitty parents that don't support me. <mp>Being depressed.
[]>capra:I can affect maybe some of those. <mp>Mostly with murder directed at me or my parents.

[]>capra:I constantly think about the impact of my actions on others. It gets intrusive sometimes.
[]>metaspirit:You live by judgment.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:You're almost as good as my therapist.

[]>metaspirit:Capra, I must warn you. The path you are on right now is not one lightly-treaded.
[]>capra:What path? You gave me a question. I just gave you an answer. That's what you have to accept.
[]>metaspirit:Just because you are blind to your own conviction, does not neccessitate they hold not fast.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Please let me get back to languishing now... I'd really like that.

[]>narrator:Rotting on your couch, there is truly nothing remarkable about this christmas. This is neither the first, nor will it be the last where you do nothing but despair on your own all evening. <lc>At least you got some fresh air.

[]>narrator:Rotting on your couch, there is truly only one remarkable about this christmas. And that is the universe-spanning entity that decided to crash into your life mere days ago. <lc>But not even it, is reliable in its pestering, or much more different than the usual ruminating thoughts.

[]>narrator:As you scroll more and more online, it is evident you aren't around anyone who would be free right now. All of the group activities online already started ages ago while you were busy with abusing alcohol.

[]>narrator:As you scroll more and more online, it is evident you aren't around anyone who would be free right now. All of the group activities online already started ages ago while you were busy soaking yourself in the vile auras of your parents.

[]>narrator:With climate change wreaking havoc on the temperatures everywhere, it's at least a good temperature for a walk outside. And so, you strap into your boots, and with your comfort hoodie still clinging to you like it has done for years now, you get ready to head out.

[]>narrator:With climate change wreaking havoc on the temperatures everywhere, it's at least a good temperature for a walk outside. And so, you strap into your boots, and with your comfort hoodie still clinging to you like it has done for years now, you get ready to head out once again.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I hope nature isn't bothered by me too much.

[]>narrator:But! Just as you are about to cross your doorstep, you get a text. It's from Icy Aloe, inviting you over. Appearently their plans for the evening fell through are are just having a small social get together at Rider's apartment now.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Social stuff is still so... <ap>Awful.
[]>narrator:You quickly text back that you can't make it, and then the christmas air makes contact with your face.

[]>narrator:You compose a message back:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:"I'll be there."
[]>narrator:Composing yourself, not so much. You might not even know their address. You'll find that out as you go.
[]>capra:"Hope you got some more beverages because I am dying."
[]>narrator:You hit send, and make your way to the bus stop to Rider's place. <lc>As you wait for any bus, you are informed of the location of the get-together, and you switch sides to the other bus stop.

[]>narrator:With a knot in your stomach, you compose a response.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:"Hi. I'll be there. Could you"- <ap>No, that's not good.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:Damn it. <ap>Pull through.
[]>capra:"Could you send me your address so I have a place to be?"
[]>capra:No.
[]>capra:"Could you send me your address so I know where to go?"
[]>narrator:You hit send. Immediately, Icy texts you the location, and then you head out.

[]>narrator:It's christmas and they're your parents. Of course you're gonna visit them. <mp>It's still a few hours until you want to show up there, so you do pretty much nothing as you rot on the couch for a few hours.
[]>narrator:Eventually though, you find yourself in the outskirts of the city. Families live here. <mp>As do your parents.

[]>narrator:You make your way through the sleet. The verticality of the city is really noticeable, as these houses are up high enough to even have anything resembling snowfall. <lc>Dragging your feet, you shovel the grimy sludge before you, kicking up pebbles and staining the cuffs of your pants. <mp>By the time you arrive at your parents' apartment block, your shins are positively dripping, and your toes are freezing.<lc>Shivering, and with a dead-eyed stare, you ring the door bell.<lc>The buzz of the door disturbs the winter silence and you make your way upstairs, where you find a closed door.

[]>narrator:You knock on the door.
[]>mom{mom-emotion|neutral}:Hi darling! We're of course so glad you could make it.
[]>narrator:You exchange pleasantries, and your mom ushers you inside. <mp>Your dad is in the living room, presumably.
[]>narrator:You enter it, and find that presumption confirmed. You step in and the space is filled with the stench of an aimless TV program and patriarchy. Your dad has the news on as background noise. He turns towards you.
[]>dad{dad-emotion|neutral}:I'm happy to see you, <ap>[deadname].

[]>narrator:Maybe they're not here. They'll probably be happy to see you, if they're here! <mp>It is also getting increasingly frigid out here, so compelled by your survival instincts, you knock on the door.
[]>mom{mom-emotion|neutral}:Oh my! <ap>[deadname]! <ap>You, here?
[]>capra:My other plans fell through.
[]>narrator:Did they, now?
[]>capra:So I thought I'd stop by anyways.
[]>narrator:I hope you're glad to be here.
[]>narrator:You exchange pleasantries, and your mom ushers you inside. <mp>Your dad is in the living room, presumably.
[]>narrator:You enter it, and find that presumption confirmed. You step in and the space is filled with the stench of an aimless TV program and patriarchy. Your dad has the news on as background noise. He turns towards you.
[]>dad{dad-emotion|neutral}:[deadname]! <ap>What a nice surprise!

[]>capra:Hello Dad.
[]>mom:Say Dear, fancy a tea? Or something else to drink?
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:She's talking to you.
[]>capra:Thank you mom. I'll take... <ap>Whatever you have. Thank you.
[]>mom:Join me then Dear, in the kitchen.

[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:She brushes your arm, no- takes it and drags you into the kitchen. <mp>You want to run.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Thank you.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:Don't forget to hide your fangs. <lc>You don't think they'd notice.
[]>mom:So how was the ride here?
[]>capra:It was a bus ride... it was okay.
[]>mom:That's good. <lc>So, how would you like some fresh rosehip tea?
[]>capra:Gladly.
[]>narrator:She continues making smalltalk with you, and when the tea is done, you emerge back in the living room.

[]>dad:Been well, son?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Yea. I've been... fine.
[]>dad:Good.
[]>narrator:You continue sipping your tea.
[]>dad:I gotta wear this damned brace now.
[]>narrator:He pulls up his pants' leg and shows you a brace around his ankle.
[]>dad:Kinked it at work. <mp>Ah your old man is old.
[]>capra:Sad. <mp>What happened?
[]>dad:Damned icy surfaces a few weeks back. Almost fell.
[]>mom:I had to pick him up from the ER, child.
[]>dad:It's nothn.<lc>Have to wear the brace for some more weeks now.<lc>Shame I can't run like before, when we two played. <ap>Those were good times, weren't they?
[]>narrator:His nostalgia is almost endearing.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:They were.
[]>narrator:If you could remember any of those years.
[]>dad:All over... <ap>all over...
[]>mom:And how are jobs going for you? A fine young rascal like you can find something, can't he?
[]>capra:Yea... <mp>I'm looking.
[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:One moment...
[]>dad:[deadname]?
[]>narrator:You turn away, towards the hallway door.
[]>capra:Sorry, I gotta go to the bathroom.
[]>mom:Are you fine?
[]>narrator:You're already out of the living room.

[]>narrator:Within seconds after locking the door, you find yourself wretching over the toilet bowl but nothing comes out. Your soul is afflicted with poison, and your parents are the IV injecting it.
[]>capra:H... hhrrh.
[]>narrator:Heaving, and head spinning, your chest is wound tight.
[]>metaspirit:[center]On the benefit of suffering[/center]

[]>metaspirit:Capra. Why do you put yourself in such distress?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:!!!
[]>narrator:If looks could kill.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Qurkk... ugh.
[]>narrator:It continues hovering in your periphery.
[]>capra:Quiet... <ap>down. Please.
[]>metaspirit:I cannot be seen by your parents. And if you have not noticed it yet, you also do not audibly talk to me. It is akin to mumbling to yourself at the most. Speaking without your voice, Capra.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Heh... I'd never thought I'd hear that name in this household.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Leave... this place.
[]>metaspirit:If only you knew how powerful your words can be. <mp>But I will not leave.
[]>capra:Of course you won't.
[]>metaspirit:The words of vampires are powerful, Capra.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Die.
[]>metaspirit:You don't mean it.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...<lc>And when I do... <mp>Is that like like how I can just talk myself into and out of depression when I want to?
[]>metaspirit:That's not a matter related to vampirism. <mp>But yes. <lc>...<lc>Why do you endure your parents so?
[]>capra:Because I have other family. <mp>My life would be better if my parents were dead. That's out of the question. <ap>But my grandma is too sweet to see our family break apart.<lc>When she dies, that'll be when I'll finally let my family-self die.
[]>metaspirit:You're a strong vampire, and a strong woman....
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Don't call me that. <ap>Not here.
[]>metaspirit:I did not mean to hurt you. I apologize.
[]>capra:Whatever.
[]>metaspirit:I am rivited by the prospect of you succeeding.
[]>capra:...<lc>I don't want to see her sad. That's all.

[]>narrator:You look in the mirror, standing on the verge of tears. <mp>You look down that cliff and back at you gazes the abyss.<lc>Under your breath, you race through your thoughts.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Deadname, manliness, I hate them so much. <lc>Get me out, please.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Why can't I just keel over and die? <lc>I want to leave.
[]>narrator:But you can't.
[]>capra:Not without arousing suspicion.
[]>narrator:You're already spending the least possible time here.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Kill me.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Mmmm. Blegh.
[]>narrator:The wavering astral forces trapped in the mirror project an ugly and decrepit husk.
[]>capra:Try not to vomit.

[]>narrator:You find yourself idly standing in the middle of the bathroom. No one seems to have come barging in, so you can't have been gone for that long yet. <mp>You should get back to your parents.

[]>narrator:You return from the bathroom. Both of your parents turn to you with worried faces.
[]>mom:Is everything alright, Dear?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Yes, mom. No worries.
[]>mom:I'm glad to hear that.
[]>dad:Did you vomit? Sounded like it.
[]>capra:No, I'm fine.
[]>narrator:He shrugs and turns back to face the coffee table. You parents don't have an actual dinner table. <mp>You were shocked and confused when you learned other people did.
[]>narrator:It seems that, before you came back in, your dad was just preparing another can of tea, a different blend this time.
[]>dad:Look, [deadname]. Isn't this nice?
[]>narrator:He points at the sieve he uses to filter out tea leaf particulates from the can's brew before they hit the cup.
[]>dad:You can't get quality like that anymore. It's already tattered but still good. <ap>At least good enough for the rough tea.
[]>capra:Yep.
[]>dad:Haha, gotcha. Disgusting little bugger.
[]>narrator:He's caught one of the bits of tea that fell through the sieve.
[]>mom:...
[]>capra:...

[]>mom:Say, Darling, since it's the holy evening, we thought you should still get something.
[]>narrator:She briefly vanishes into the hallway. <lc>Your father continues watching TV in silence. <lc>When your mother returns, she hands you a card.
[]>mom:We know you're not one for cards, but we found this one quite amusing. <ap>And hope you will too.
[]>capra:Heh. Thanks.
[]>narrator:You open it, and find not a single written word inside. Just a small amount of cash, approximately enough to fund almost a month of hormone therapy for you. <lc>"If only they knew", you muse to yourself.<lc>You flip the cover and the front is indeed, quite silly- <ap>For your parents' generation. <ap>A flat and inoffensive pun that is appliccable to the broadest audience possible.
[]>capra:Thanks, you two.
[]>narrator:You give your mother a quick hug, not too firmly to hide your growing chest, and then put the money in your jacket outside.

[]>narrator:When you return, the TV has switched to a news broadcast on the Phean War.
[]>dad:All of those biters from Leventia... <ap>Or Lethonia, coming to us.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Dad, those are like... entirely different countries. They have very different histories and stuff.
[]>dad:You know how I mean it. <mp>You know I don't take those things that exact.
[]>capra:...
[]>dad:Should just die for their country.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>narrator:Your mom and you exchange glances. You don't know how approving she is of this.
[]>mom:Should I refill your tea? Do you want some food?
[]>narrator:...approving enough to still be married to him.
[]>capra:I'll just take some tea, thank you. I'm not that hungry yet I think.
[]>mom:Don't fall apart now here.
[]>dad:Have you had those migrants come to your district yet?
[]>capra:Not really, no. 
[]>dad:That's good. 
[]>capra:How do you mean?
[]>dad:Wouldn't want them around me, that's for sure.
[]>capra:Sure.
[]>dad:Point is, we had witches come here when I was your age, maybe a bit younger, and that didn't go too well, as you may know. <mp> I don't need any murderous bloodsuckers coming here and ruining our country..
[]>capra:Again, very different groups.
[]>dad:Watch your mouth, now.

[]>narrator:You don't know what escalating the situation would do, so you let it slide. Your father drones on.
[]>dad:You know, [deadname], when I was about your age, we had a few witches too. Fine gals. <lc>But eventually they got too uppity.<lc>It's just like all of those repression champions these days, saying everything is oppressing them. 
[]>mom:Sometimes we should listen to others though, don't you think?
[]>dad:Ah, listen, Sonia, if we always listened to everyone, we wouldn't get anything done. <lc>Not as if you'd know anything about that, ha.
[]>narrator:He shoots you a glance, "Women, am I right?". How your mom can stay with this guy is beyond you.
[]>dad:Those druggie witches ruined entire cities with their stuff. Spread... <ap>drugs and disease everywhere they went.

[]>dad:And look, why do we have to have these arguments anyways? My pals and I, the rascals, from way back when at the chop shop, we alsohuv some differences in opinion. And, and when we meet up. Well let's just say we can put that aside and we don't talk about politics.<lc>Why can't we do that too?
[]>narrator:Silence. Is your dad even talking *to* anyone?
[]>dad:What you're talking about, [deadname], isn't even accurate.
[]>capra:Okay?
[]>dad:All-a those here differences. <mp>They really aren't there. If Leventia or Lethonia. Those Saramese and Neolites... They have a few diners here and- and I don't taste any differences. <lc>They don't have to divide into all that.
[]>narrator:You wish you knew what any of this has to do with anything.
[]>mom:But statements like those are exactly why they might noe feel welcome here, don't you think?
[]>dad:Well I donwannem here.
[]>narrator:You say your goodbyes, and off you go.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Dad. I'm sick and tired of your bullshit.
[]>narrator:Your parents seem taken aback by your vocalization.
[]>capra:You keep not giving a single fuck about anything of this damn country, and even within it, I think your concerns are absolutely...<ap> wild. <lc>Witches got hunted in the 70s and 80s because you all decided they didn't deserve to live, not because they were statistically any different than you or me.
[]>dad:Who is you all? Isn't that generalizing of you too?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:You is- <ap>are-
[]>dad:And I was only a child during those years, too.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:But you still defend it today!
[]>capra:And- <ap> And with you I mean all of you worthless men that upheld- <ap>Uphold this shit patriarchy! <lc>You killed hundreds of women for nothing more than being- <ap> Being esoteric lesbians that like to party.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Real people died, dad.
[]>dad:And where do you take those numbers from? The government?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Lived accounts by actual people... and yes, studies and surveys.
[]>dad:You always with your studies, can't trust 'em.
[]>capra:...
[]>dad:So you'd just let all of them in here, and do as they please?
[]>capra:Yes, damn it.
[]>dad:And what if those biters got you, huh? Would you just give your blood to someone who doesn't give anything in return?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Yes. Because I have empathy.
[]>dad:Are you saying I don't have empathy?
[]>mom:[deadname], please...
[]>capra:Possibly.
[]>dad:Well that takes the cake.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Vampirism is not just about wanting to bite someone occasionally. And it's not transmissable. Their fangs literally grow out and then they need to consume hemoglobin to survive. It's a medical need. <lc>They don't kill random people and- <ap> and there's vegan supplements out there even. <lc>There is just no need to be this hostile towards them.
[]>dad:I'm not judging all of them.
[]>dad:There was that one biter a few years back on TV...
[]>capra:Don't use that word.
[]>dad:Excuse me?
[]>capra:Don't call vampires biter.
[]>dad:What do you know about that huh? When I grew up, I was taught it was okay to say.<lc>What? Just because you've taken a few college classes on history you suddenly know everything?
[]>narrator:Accusingly, his finger is pointed at you, hand raised right towards your face.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I don't.
[]>dad:Then don't lecture me with your heart-of-gold insanity.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm just saying you could read up on developments from the last 50 years every once in a while. <ap>And not just blindly hate others.
[]>dad:As if it matters to you.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:It does.
[]>dad:Or is it because you're all knowledgeable on you self-victimizers because you're a faggot with a few dicks in his mouth?
[]>mom:Henry!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Just shut the fuck up.
[]>dad:Repeat that?
[]>capra:I said shut up.
[]>dad:I think you said something else too.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Perhaps I did.
[]>dad:Well yeah, perhaps you should learn some manners then, young man.
[]>capra:I'm gonna leave.
[]>dad:Fine then.
[]>mom:Please don't. <ap>I want our family to be at peace at least on Christmas.
[]>capra:I'm sorry mom. <ap>I just can't with him.
[]>mom:...
[]>dad:Oh yeah, now it's all my fault again.
[]>narrator:He stands up to leave.
[]>capra:I've had enough.
[]>narrator:You pack your stuff and leave without another word.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:[center]I want my parents to fucking die.[/center]

[]>narrator:You step outside into the night, a small drizzle now giving shape to the light cones of the streetlamps.
[]>capra:I'm so done with this shit.
[]>narrator:The wet squelching of your chucks is the only soundscape filling the air.

[]>narrator:Some people from the hot sauce enjoyers server should be hanging out in meatspace right now. Maybe they'd mind you showing up unannounced, but it'd always beat spiraling into depression at home. Right?
[]>narrator:There's not many places to go at this hour. It's christmas evening, and your hate your family.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Go home. Just get some rest, maybe hang out online.
Take the scenic route. Have a chat with Metaspirit.

content.content: []>narrator:As you wade through these city streets, lonely as they always are on christmas eve, you gaze up at the moon. <ap>Or at least where it might be. <lc>The rain clouds cover you in a light drizzle, and it gets cold.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I have a question. <lc>If vampires and witches draw upon that web thing- <ap>Why are we still subordinate to other humans then?
[]>metaspirit:Others might be better equipped at answering that.
[]>capra:I thought you were like... <mp>Is old okay to say?
[]>metaspirit:Ageless is more accurate.
[]>capra:Sorry, then ageless. <lc>But that's what I mean, shouldn't you have access and memories- access to knowledge and memories, to these things? Or am I completely stupid?
[]>metaspirit:This form is still... limited. The cosmos hardly works on a scale of societies. <mp>The systems and structures in which the kin exist, in constructed outside of it. <mp>What you understand as capitalism and patriarchy, is well-equipped to adapt to the forces of eldrich magics.
[]>capra:So what you are saying is that...<ap>We cannot do anything because of some guys in suits?
[]>metaspirit:As our kin has started witnessing it, that is correct.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I hate that.
[]>metaspirit:Where are you going?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:My parents live high up and I saw a gas station when I was up there. I want to see if maybe- <ap>You'll see.
[]>metaspirit:The information is appreciated. But I meant your explication.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Oh. Sorry.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Well, I-<ap> I-<ap> I forgot.
[]>capra:...
[]>metaspirit:...
[]>capra:...<lc>Where was I?
[]>metaspirit:The systems around vampi-
[]>capra:Yes! <lc>I should start dismantling some of those.
[]>metaspirit:How do you mean?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:One second.
[]>narrator:You turn a corner, and like a moth to a flame, you have found your way to the brightly-lit gas station. Undeterred, you head to the late-night counter.

[]>capra:Uhm... <ap> Four of those small herbal liquors please.
[]>gas-station-clerk:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>gas-station-clerk:ID?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:... <lc>One second please.
[]>narrator:You get out your ID. Since you started estrogen the frequency of this happening has increased again. <lc>After doing a double take with the still male-gendered ID info, the clerk puts your requested phials into the sliding tray, and you take them.
[]>gas-station-clerk:Here you go.
[]>capra:Thank you. <ap>Thanks.
[]>narrator:You start downing them like sweet confections.
[]>metaspirit:That is what you went here for?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I'll still look insane when I talk and mumble to myself in the middle of the night. Let's get away from this gas station first.
[]>metaspirit:...
[]>narrator:After a few blocks, the effects of the liquors hit your almost-empty stomach.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Come to think of it, fuck my parents. <lc>Right, that's where we were.
[]>narrator:Fuck your parents.
[]>capra:Exactly.
[]>metaspirit:Capra?
[]>capra:These fucking fucks think they can just treat their... <ap>child... <ap>GOD I HATE THEM SO MUCH.
[]>capra:THEY ARE RACIST FUCKS THAT WOULD RATHER SEE MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES DEAD THAN HAPPY!
[]>metaspirit:You have not told them that you are trans?
[]>capra:Not worth it. They wouldn't honor it anways.
[]>metaspirit:How do you know?
[]>capra:Because they are abusive assholes that ruined my childhood.

choices.choice_text.enabled: And I am going to kill them now.
But I will spare them regardless.

content.content:
[]>capra:I won't kill them. Not actually.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:I just wish they'd dissolve, you know?

[]>narrator:With the rain now getting heavier, you really should hurry home.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:It really is pitch-black out here.

[]>metaspirit:I'm proud of you for not giving into your destructive urges.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|angry-drunk}:I'm not.
[]>metaspirit:Vampires can become soulless shades when they die after they kill.
[]>capra:Maybe that would suit me, who knows. <lc>I think I can handle existential torture quite well now. That's- <ap> I think that's like the one thing I have going for me.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I should really hurry home, it's getting cold out here.

[]>capra:Hi...
[]>icy-aloe:You must be Capra, right?
[]>capra:Yes...
[]>rider:Well hi, I'm Rider!
[]>icy-aloe:I'm Icy.
[]>narrator:That's a cool name.<lc>...
[]>capra:Hi.
[]>starry:And I'm Starry!
[]>narrator:Starry offers you a hug. You weakly accept.
[]>narrator:As has become the norm in most winter months, snow is nowhere to be seen. Instead, you all find yourselves drenched by rain.

[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated}:Man, fuck this.
[]>starry:It's kinda a generational thing. The I Don't Need An Umbrella thing.
[]>rider:At least I have style.
[]>icy-aloe:Sodden garments. Lovely.
[]>rider:The only downside of going vegan is not buying new leather clothes. I am fucking soaked.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Can't wait to finally get inside.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:I like the rain. I enjoy it.

[]>narrator:Eventually, after a few just-above-freezing minutes, you get up to the bouncer to present your tickets. He stops Rider.
[]>bouncer{starry-emotion|sad}:You there. Lose the terrorism apologia.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated}:...The what?
[]>bouncer:The scarf. <ap>Those Liberation Front terrorists use the same symbol.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:They're... they're fighting against imperialism.
[]>bouncer:Alright. Get out of my sight.

[]>rider:Just what is your problem? We're just here to enjoy the concert.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|serious}:We have tickets.
[]>bouncer{capra-emotion|spiraling}:You're looking for trouble with that getup. Now stop holding up the queue, and take it off if you want to enter.
[]>narrator:Starry already started turning away.
[]>icy-aloe:You're scum.
[]>rider:Let him be, Icy.
[]>narrator:Rider is just a few steps behind Starry, hand on Icy's shoulder. <lc>The bouncer shoots you a look. <ap>Unsure what to do about this, you follow the others.

[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated}:Man, what the fuck.
[]>starry:Where do you wanna go now?
[]>narrator:You're all starting to get cold.
[]>rider:Fucking... <ap>My place? We could just hang out there?
[]>capra:I'm okay with that.
[]>icy-aloe:Same.
[]>starry:Then let's go.
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Then back to the tram station we go.

[]>icy-aloe:Didn't Angel and Crosscull mention going to a party?
[]>rider:Uhhh... maybe. <ap>But I have no idea where.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:We could ask if they want to join us. Afterwards.
[]>starry{starry-emotion|neutral}:I doubt they'll check their phones this soon.
[]>rider:Well if not it's their fucking loss and more weed for us.
[]>starry:Yeah, just tell them it's a skill issue.
[]>icy-aloe:I will not.
[]>capra:But maybe we could text them? Just in case they might have time?
[]>icy-aloe:On it.
[]>rider:Sweet.

[]>narrator:Upon entering the apartment, the warm glow of fake incandescent light bulbs wraps itself around your forms. Almost to a blinding degree, the orange drowns out almost all other hues.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:This is very... orange.
