[]>rider:yeah, when we moved in, I didn't know what was the correct light temp to get... It just needed to be vampire friendly, so I got the warmest they had.
[]>starry:And they sure are vampire-friendly.
[]>capra:Hm...
[]>capra:Since you said we, I am curious. Who else lives here?
[]>starry:Me.
[]>capra:Oh...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Sorry. I didn't know.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Could we please step out of the doorway now?
[]>starry:True, go through the living room everyone.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:When you've slid out of your shoes, you follow the others. Someone has already started hooking up their phone to the speaker.<lc>Entering the living room, it is sparse in furnishing with not much more than a solitary lamp, a couch, and a table with backless stools. On one of them, you see Rider, building a joint.
[]>rider:Forgot to do this all evening...
[]>icy-aloe:...<lc>I'm getting something to drink.
[]>rider:As for you...
[]>narrator:He turns to you.

[]>rider:We should have enough beer around for all of us.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Great. <lc>I'll get it.
[]>starry:Can you bring me an energy drink from the fridge?
[]>icy-aloe:Sure.
[]>narrator:And then, Icy ideed returns with beer for you, Rider, and herself, and an energy drink for Starry.

[]>rider:We should even have a bottle of that orange soda you got at the concert lying around here... somewhere.
[]>capra:Thank you. Thanks.
[]>rider:Yea, just plunder the kitchen, it'll be somewhere.
[]>icy-aloe:Wanna come get the drinks with me?
[]>capra:Sure. I guess.
[]>narrator:With a bit of searching, you find it, tucked away in the fridge, nice and cold. You return with beer for Icy and Rider, and an energy drink for Starry.

[]>rider:I have no idea what you wanna drink Capra, so just have at it.
[]>icy-aloe:Want some beer?

[]>capra:I'd take that, if it's okay for you?
[]>rider:'Course it is.
[]>starry:Can you bring me an energy drink from the fridge?
[]>icy-aloe:Sure.
[]>narrator:And then, Icy indeed returns with beer for you, Rider, and herself, and an energy drink for Starry.

[]>capra:Is it okay- <ap>If I ask for something non-alcoholic?
[]>rider:We have... water and energy drinks.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Energy?
[]>capra:If it's not too much to ask...
[]>rider:Listen, 'course it isn't.
[]>starry:Could you also bring me one?
[]>icy-aloe:Sure.
[]>narrator:And then, Icy returns with beer for Rider and herself, and an energy drink for Starry and you.

[]>narrator:When Icy returns, Rider has finished his small construction project, and lights up the joint. Starry passes it to you.
[]>capra:Sorry, I don't do weed anymore. Let's just say... psychosis.
[]>rider:Then not!

[]>narrator:The comfort of silence and a secluded four walls now finally setting in, your metabolism is now making itself known.
[]>capra:Rider, could I use your bathroom for a bit please?
[]>rider:No need to ask. It's the door to the left there.
[]>capra:Got it.

[]>narrator:Going into the bathroom, you notice all of the mirrors being covered up with incredibly thin shutters. <mp>Maybe starry prefers it this way?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Something to ask them later.<lc>...<lc>...
[]>narrator:And then you finish releasing, and take a deep breath. Your heart is pounding, this is the first time in someone's apartment.
[]>narrator:You cannot mess this up.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I'm trying. 
[]>narrator:Don't be weird.
[]>capra:I know.
[]>narrator:Know it with certainty.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:I do. <ap>Fuck.
[]>narrator:You're already dilly-dallying here. <ap>Get back out there.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Damn. Yes. Sorry.
[]>narrator:You straighten out your face, wipe the small trickle of tears away, and head back to the others.

[]>narrator:When you enter the bathroom, you almost have the urge to vomit again.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Not now... <lc>Please. <mp>I can't immediately make a mess in here.
[]>narrator:Focusing on your inner sanctum, you suppress the impulse.
[]>narrator:It is only when you get up again, that you realize that all of the mirrors are covered with incredibly thin shutters. <mp>Maybe starry prefers it this way?

[]>metaspirit:I'm proud of you.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:What for?<lc>You just appearing out of nowhere-<ap> It's always so- <ap>Unexpected.
[]>metaspirit:I apologize. It is not unusual for the material ones like you to- Require time to adjust to this.
[]>capra:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Will you always just spook me when I'm alone?
[]>metaspirit:That is not the aim. <lc>I am aware it would greatly exhaust your mental fortitude.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...<lc>Yes.<lc>Sorry.
[]>metaspirit:The aim instead is keeping you with current developments.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:And what are some developments like that, now?
[]>metaspirit:You meeting new vampires, for instance.
[]>capra:Is it that special? <lc>It's also super stressful for me.
[]>metaspirit:That might be. <ap>But the kinds of vampire you meet are quite noteworthy.
[]>capra:Is it because of... Starry's glitchiness?
[]>metaspirit:Precisely. Starry's fangs are quite new, yes.<lc>The digital is a realm of memeticism. Ideas and thought and the abstract and immaterial shape its confines. <mp>And that has slowly started bleeding into the cosmic lattice, interweaving with it, the Abyss unable to fully assimilate it.
[]>capra:And that's-<ap> bad? <ap>From the sounds of it.
[]>metaspirit:That remains to be seen. <mp>Starry are not responsible for it as an individual, they did not choose this archetype. <lc>This is merely a concrete vector of a new phenomenon, and it is uncertain how the Metaspirit or the lattice will react.
[]>capra:Talking in third person now?
[]>metaspirit:This is merely a representation, remember.
[]>capra:You're right. Sorry.
[]>capra:Okay so we just talked about not always talking... <lc>But I've also been wondering... Why do you always appear when I'm in the bathroom?
[]>metaspirit: It makes for good pacing.
[]>capra:Pacing? Pacing of what?
[]>metaspirit:[center]The cadence of the empty cosmos.[/center]

[]>narrator: It feels like the universe just crashed on top of you and then immediately sunk right through you.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Ugh... What was that?
[]>metaspirit:You may know in time, Capra.<lc>And another reason why a bathroom is convenient Is that time does not stop when you talk to me. So unless I want you to have two conversations at once, I cannot just barge in there.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Huh... I get it.<lc>So... any reason why you are here now?
[]>metaspirit:Nothing more than we already spoke about. <lc>I do hope you are not suffering by talking to me.
[]>capra:I'm not... I don't think.
[]>narrator:You should go back.
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:Now. <lc>You're already dilly-dallying too much here.
[]>capra:...<lc>Hey, Spirit. Is it okay if I head out again?
[]>metaspirit:Naturally.
[]>capra:You're welcome. <ap> I mean okay, good. <ap>Shit.
[]>metaspirit:Until later.

[]>narrator:You close the bathroom door behind you, leaving the revenant behind. <mp>Maybe it alone decides when to leave you be. <lc>Absent in thought, you almost trip over the doorstep on your way back to the living room. <mp>Maybe it's best to discard the prospect of you never having had any privacy in that bathroom for now.

[]>narrator: It is time to confirm your intentions. <lc>"Ayo I'd like to come with" <lc>You deliberate. Maybe there's another, better, wording. More appropriate? Can you ever find such a thing? <mp>Backspace.<lc>"please take me with you"<lc>Backspace.<lc>"hiiiiii"<lc>Backspace.<lc>"Is the offer to join the two of you at the club still valid?"<lc>Will they hate you if you are too awkward or formal about this? You definitely shouldn't be too formal, but also not so casual you impose on them. Right? <mp>Backspace.<lc>"I'd also come with tonight if it's fine with you."<lc> But they invited you. And. And. <ap>What if you just tricked them? <lc> You delete and re-type the message about 5 more times. And then you hit send. <lc>"Can I still come to Citrine with you?" <mp>Definitely not the best wording of the bunch you went through. But your brain has dissolved itself now and there's no rectifying this anyways. You chuck the phone onto your bed and it does a little bounce. <mp>Then you await a response.

[]>narrator: Not even 2 minutes later, you get an answer from Angel. <lc> "Sure thing! Crosscull is already here and we wanna head out in a bit. How's meeting at the station sound?" Not fully sure of the extent of alternatives, you agree, and a few minutes later, you head out.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Ugh.
[]>narrator:The sun.
[]>capra:It's a deadly laser.
[]>narrator:Despite the pale winter sun setting on the horizon already, it's still enough to make you flinch.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Screw this... <mp>I already want to go back home.
[]>narrator:Maybe you should.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Maybe I should.
[]>narrator:Your turn back around.<lc>You aim your keys back at the lock.<lc>Your heart stings.
[]>capra:I can't just turn around like this. <mp>I told them I'd be there.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:Why...
[]>narrator:The forming tears in your eyes are making it difficult to keep a clear head. <mp>The door starts to blur in front of you.
[]>capra:I can't. <lc>I can't do this. <lc>This is all too much.

[]>narrator:You look down on your phone. <ap>A notification from Angel.<lc>You open it.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm so pathetic.
[]>narrator:The image of Angel's and Crossculls legs and boots stirs in your brain. "on our way now" the caption reads.
[]>capra:I can't just bail again.
[]>narrator:You turn around again, and pull up your hood. <ap>Destined to reach the train station.<lc>On your way, you send a thumbs up reaction back.
[]>narrator: The train ride is uneventful. The events of just a few minutes ago feel so distant already, your uncertainties now replaced with the usual calm before the storm of social anxiety.

[]>narrator:When you step outside, your heart starts racing. <mp>When the train starts Departing again, it is pounding. <mp>When you hear Angel, fight or flight has already started kicking in and the skies are ever clear.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}: Capra!
[]>crosscull: Good to meet again.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}: Spiraling...
[]>angel: How are you?
[]>capra:...Good.
[]>angel:Awesome!
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:I really like this place. We can just walk there from here.
[]>crosscull: Only 14 minutes.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}: I can handle walking.
[]>angel: Very good. That's super practical. Then let's go!
[]>narrator: And so you do.

[]>narrator: The three of you leave the train station. You trot up the overhead bridge, and walk through a low density part of town. Trees line your way, and several rivulets are all bridged by sleek minimalist footpath bridges. 
[]>angel: So how has your day been so far Capra?
[]>capra: Not really much.
[]>angel: Just relaxing?
[]>capra: I guess. I just watched online videos.
[]>crosscull: What do you watch?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}: Ummm. Speedrunning. I also do it myself but the current meta techs are pretty difficult to pull off and I can't scrum with others and don't have that much motivation anyways.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:I hope you won't mind when I say I only got like half of that.
[]>crosscull: She practices games at a high technical skill in her free time but practice takes a lot of time, which she doesn't have.
[]>capra: Basically. Yes.
[]>narrator: You have to ask Crosscull how much xe knows about speedrunning at some point.
[]>angel: Ah. Thanks. 
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}: I finally finished the last chapter of the first act of the fanfiction I'm currently writing. It's some gay shit.
[]>crosscull: You're also looking for proofreaders.
[]>capra: Uh huh.
[]>angel: Yea- <ap>uhm- <ap>if you wanted to I could send you the chapter and you could tell me what you think. It's a really slow burn though. <mp>In the story and production that is.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}: Sure. I don't read much though.
[]>angel: Don't force yourself. I'll just send you the link later.
[]>capra: Alright.
[]>angel:This thing has been in production for god knows how long now. <mp>Maybe over two years?
[]>angel{angel-emotion|sad}:It might never get finished.
[]>capra:Many creative things are like that.
[]>angel:Sadly.
[]>crosscull: It's down the street.
[]>narrator: You turn off the bridge, the cobblestone road is bathed in the orange sunset.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}: There on the right. That small cluster of people is where we need to go.

[]>narrator:The cluster of people is quite sizeable to you. <lc>At least 20 people, waiting outside, some of them smoking and/or drinking.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I've never been here...
[]>crosscull:Would have been surprising.
[]>capra:What can I say? I really don't go out much.
[]>angel:You'll get used to it. First we gotta get our stamps for the evening.
[]>capra:We do. <ap>Yes.<ap> True.

[]>narrator:You get up to the people managing the entryway, and a professional bouncer like they live in your head is nowhere to be seen. It's just two guys in hoodies with a sheet of paper and tally marks. <lc>Angel and Crosscull go ahead and hold out their wrists for stamping, and then you follow suit.
[]>narrator:And with that, you make your way up the staircase, following the ever-increasing loudness of electronic music.

[]>narrator:You enter the room and it is illuminated by an otherworldly mix of fire and neon. Old, rusty boilers radiate heat into the space, and strobe lights and UV reflectors adorn the ceiling.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:Wanna go grab something to drink?
[]>crosscull:Strongly affirmative.
[]>capra:C'mon then!
[]>narrator:Angel throws you a glance, so you follow the both of them. <lc>The club is filled with people.

[]>capra:I'm gonna get us drinks. What do you all want?
[]>crosscull:Mat.
[]>capra:Beer.
[]>angel:Gotcha.
[]>narrator:Heading for the bar, Angel switftly returns with the beverages for all of you.

[]>capra:I'm gonna get us drinks. What do you all want?
[]>crosscull:Mat.
[]>capra:...<lc>What is that, if you don't mind me asking?
[]>angel:Tea, but with lots of caffeine.
[]>crosscull:Some posit it tastes like ashtray. <lc>They are mistaken.
[]>capra:...<lc>That's weird to hear. But I'll also try that, then.
[]>narrator:Heading for the bar, Angel switftly returns with a bottle of mat tea for each of you.

[]>crosscull: I will go look for Haley.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:Of course. Go enjoy yourselves!

[]>angel:Rider... <ap> mentioned Harleys mom. Crosscull and Haley go way back, so they might be occupied with each other for a while, catching up and such. <lc>I don't know if you'll meet her tonight, but she's really cool.

[]>narrator:The blacklights overhead are illuminating the scene. Vampire fangs, and even occasional witch eyes shimmer iridescently.
[]>capra: There are witches here?
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}: Of course. This is safe space for all of us. <mp>Means you also don't have to be worried around mirrors. No one here cares how visible you are in them.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:That's at least something.
[]>narrator:The eery liminal nature of not knowing anyone or their capabilities here scares you.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}: This might be a stupid question, but how do we stay safe here? <mp>I know you said this is a safe place, but I just can't understand that. Not really. Sorry.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:We just do. <lc> People here know how to treat each other; No photos, only yes is consent, all the good things.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:That seems... really weak to me. <lc>Blind trust?
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Not many alternatives. <lc>And it actually works.
[]>capra:..
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Okay.
[]>angel:It's what I love about this place. Just to get you up to speed, if you ever feel unsafe or have like a drug-related emergency, there's an awareness team on site most nights on the ground floor.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Scary...
[]>angel:Just for safety. <mp>Speaking of, do you take anything?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I have some history with alcohol and painkillers... <mp>But that doesn't really count. No worries. I'm fine.
[]>angel:I'm glad to hear.
[]>angel:Would you like to try some speed?
[]>angel:Do be warned though, it's not that good with alcohol. It can mask its effects. So. Would you like some?

[]>capra:I've never taken , <ap>umm, <ap> something like that. <ap>What is the feeling like?
[]>angel:It always varies from person to person, obviously. But generally, you just feel a heightened sense of... everything. <lc>You feel so damn productive. You're not, because you're on speed, but you feel like it. <mp>And it also helps you stay awake, which is generally nice.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Why would you want that? I really like sleep.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:It's what makes it more of a common drug around vampires.
[]>crosscull{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Helps us stay up all night.
[]>capra:Oh my god. Where did you come from? Sorry, you surprised me there.
[]>crosscull:Hehe. <mp>Just getting drinks for Haley and me. She has backstage access. <mp>Very pleasant.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:Sweet!
[]>narrator:Crosscull continues on xer way.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:So?

[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Let's head to the bathroom then, it's a bit quieter there.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:But isn't this meant to...<ap> not be quiet?
[]>angel:You are correct. But we also don't want anyone bumping into us. That would be quite sad and expensive.
[]>capra:I get it. You're right.
[]>angel:Then let's go.

[]>narrator:Among the confusing club layout, walls full of graffiti, and degendered bathrooms, your only point of orientation is right besides angel. <lc>Unsure of where to head, you stop in the middle of the toilets, while she advances to one of the stalls. <mp>She turns around.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Come on.
[]>narrator:She motions for you to follow her into the stall.
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:You throw her a questioning look back.
[]>angel:Capra.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Sorry, sorry.
[]>narrator:You quietly follow her.
[]>angel:Lock the door, please.
[]>capra:Okay.
[]>narrator:Procuring a small stainless steel metal phial, Angel draws out a thin and precise line extracted with the implement. <mp>She promptly sniffs it.
[]>angel:And now you!
[]>narrator{capra-emotion|neutral}:Angel presents you with an equal line, and with a stinging sensation up your nose and inside your skull, you too, inhale it.
[]>angel:Good.<lc>...
[]>capra:...
[]>angel:Let me know if you feel bad or anything. The effects should kick in in about 15 minutes.
[]>capra:Understood.
[]>angel:I'll stay in here for a bit still, I'll meet you outside.
[]>capra:I'll also be gone for a bit.
[]>angel:Oh, where to?
[]>capra:Just... <ap>Also, the bathroom.
[]>angel:Gotcha.
[]>narrator:You leave the stall, and move to another free one. <lc>Eventually, you two find yourself back in the main floor back with angel.

[]>capra:Just doesn't sound like my thing. I'm sorry.
[]>angel:That's totally fine, do you still wanna come with me to the bathroom for a bit?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Sure. <ap>Sorry.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|consoling}:Oh what for? You can take and not take whatever you want. I'm amazed at how raw you're taking all the vampire stuff.
[]>capra:But this isn't just a vampire thing, isn't it?
[]>angel:Well, no, but it's still widely-spread for us.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Well, I'll go take a break in the bathroom.
[]>capra:I will too. Just- <ap> you know, not for that.
[]>narrator:With people using the doors arbitrarily, you notice the toilets to be completely degendered. <mp>You just follow angel as far as courtesy allows and so you each vanish into different stalls.

[]>narrator:As you take a breather on the toilet, you check your phone. One missed call from your parents.<lc>You sigh to yourself. It's not worth it. You'll remember to check in the morning. <mp>(You won't.)
[]>narrator:The metaspirit thing is starting to weigh you down quite a bit. Maybe Angel woud be someone to console you over this situation?

[]>capra:Hey, can I quickly tell you something?
[]>angel:Oh of course.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:It's...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:It's messed up though. I really don't want to burden you with this.
[]>angel:Clearly it's on your mind already. <lc>So tell me! You already asked!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...<lc>...
[]>capra: I've started seeing something called the metaspirit.

[]>angel:And what is it to you? 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:You're not- <ap> You don't think I'm insane?
[]>angel:Well, maybe it is a problem for you. But for that I need to know what it is, because I cannot imagine what that would be.
[]>capra:Sorry. Makes sense.
[]>angel:So what is it?

choices.choice_text.enabled: It's the collective unconscious of all vampires, I think.

content.content:
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:That sounds like... <ap>A handful. Is it okay if I let Crosscull know about this? Xe might be interested in that and is generally better equipped for such topics.
[]>capra:Aren't you like... top extrovert vampire here?
[]>angel:I just enjoy other people. CC knows esotericism.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:So. I'd recommend xer.

content.content:

[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Just texting CC now. So we don't forget to tell xer later.

43.page_key: optional talk to angel about metaspirit

content.content:
[]>narrator:It's probably better this way.
[]>angel:Well alright. But let me know if you have any issues you need someone to talk to. <ap>We might not know each other for that long but I can't not help others.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Thank you.
[]>angel:Can I ask you something, though?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:To that my answer is, it depends on the question. <mp>Sorry, might not be down for everything.
[]>angel:Oh of course. Just let me know if you want me to stop talking.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Hm.
[]>angel:...
[]>capra:...
[]>angel:So...

[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>angel:Can I ask a question now?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Uhm... <ap>Sure. Go ahead.
[]>angel:So you don't use Artihem or other artificial blood.
[]>capra:Indeed. Yes.
[]>angel:And you also don't have donors?
[]>capra:Hm.
[]>angel:How does it feel?
[]>capra:How does what feel?
[]>angel:Being a constantly starving vampire, from my understanding.
[]>capra:Pretty normal... <lc>I don't know what to say. It's just how I've always been.<lc>...<lc>...<lc>I guess you could maybe describe it as being trans without access to HRT- <ap>hormones. <mp>You might get by but it's also not the best thing in the world.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|consoling}:Isn't that... really awful?
[]>capra:You could say that. But it's not like it matters. <lc>I got access to HRT and it improved my life and then almost immediately I had to take other hormones because otherwise my jaw would have been cracked by my half-misshapen fang anatomy.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...<lc>Overall it feels very lifeless and dull.<lc>...<lc>Thankless, too.
[]>angel:Oh that sounds horrible.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:It's whatever.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|sad}:I don't think I've lived without my friends as donors in years.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Your friends?<lc>Wait... wait, wait.
[]>angel:Yes?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Like Crosscull?
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Including xer.
[]>capra:How does it feel to bite someone? <lc>Is it like a regular thing?
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:Of course it's a regular thing! It's food!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:But I can live without!
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:But you are miserable, aren't you?

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:It's not as if I could do anything about it.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|consoling}:Sorry, Capra.<lc>It's still a very physically involved process, so I'd only offer you some of my blood if you come back screened for infections.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:No need, like I said. <lc>I get by.
[]>angel:...
[]>capra:...<lc>Thank you. <lc>And sorry for apologizing so much.
[]>angel:It's okay. I understand.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:But! <ap> But to get back to your question, it feels really refreshing. It's not as intimite as it sounds, especially when you get used to it. <lc>Maybe taking hormones is equivalent to it in feeling, I don't know. <lc>But also, this casual level of intimacy is part of the reason why there's overlap with queer people and vampires.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:How do you mean? That's going over my head.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:If you dont have access to artifical blood, your only option is consensual biting. Conservatives and liberals will insist on rigid gender roles and bland definitions of affection, and this flies square in the face of that.
[]>capra:Seems logical...
[]>angel:We are a threat to them and soften them up because our mutual tenderness is what keeps us alive. We don't need them and their mental prisons.
[]>capra:Yea...
[]>angel:...
[]>narrator:The music keeps going at it for a few more minutes in which you just sit there, enjoying the vibe. <mp>This might finally be a place where you feel seen afterall.

[]>narrator:And then through the haze of overhead lights and smoke machines, the ever-ephemeral Crosscull reemerges. Angel turns towards xer direction, and you notice xer too then.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:How was it?
[]>crosscull:Exquisite.

[]>narrator:Angel takes out her phone.
[]>angel:Oh also, Starry texted me, they're with Rider and Icy. Seems like their concert plans fell through and they invited us.
[]>capra:Isn't it already late?
[]>narrator:You check your phone. <ap>0:30 AM.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Have to go home already?
[]>capra:Not really...
[]>narrator:It's the perfect vampire hour.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Stay with Angel and Crosscull. Join up with the others.

content.content:
[]>capra:I'll stay with you.
[]>crosscull:Delightful.
[]>angel:Let's head out then.

[]>narrator:When you step outside,the cool nightly breeze feels like a gentle embrace by the world you so know and love and cherish. <lc>As the three of you make your way back to the train station to take one of the nightly routes to where you suppose Rider lives, Crosscull pipes up.

[]>crosscull:Feelings on the moth?
[]>capra:...
[]>crosscull:...
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Moth?
[]>crosscull:Capra.
[]>capra:...<lc>Moth?
[]>crosscull:What presents to you as the- <ap>Spirit.
[]>capra: ...<mp>Angel did text you about it.
[]>crosscull:And am familiar with it.
[]>capra:And for you it looks like a moth?
[]>crosscull:As stated. <mp>Xerocnephasia rigana.
[]>capra:Bless you.
[]>crosscull:The species it presents as. <mp>For completeness.
[]>capra:Uh huh. <lc>And what do I think of it?
[]>crosscull:It hasn't talked to me much yet. It appeared- <ap>Four years ago.<lc>Observes, I think.
[]>capra:Mine is much more talkative. I wish it'd stop. It's been a few days and it's already grating my nerves, honestly. <mp>The only good thing is, I think I can make it shut up at will. So that's nice.
[]>crosscull:What is- <ap>The visual side?
[]>capra:Awful. Like a nightmare or sleep paralysis demon. <mp>Ugh, I don't even want to think about it, if I'm honest.
[]>crosscull:Apologies. Not moth-sized?
[]>capra:Try more so... <lc>Almost ceiling-height.
[]>angel:I won't lie, I have no idea what you two are talking about but it sounds horrifying.
[]>capra:It's fine. <mp>Nothing I'm not used to. <lc>But can we... please switch the topic for now?
[]>crosscull:Certainly.

[]>crosscull:Time with Haley was nice again.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:Oh, lovely!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:And she, <ap>owns the place?
[]>crosscull:Her mother organizes events. <lc>No owners.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:Correct. No one really owns Citrine on their own. Haley's mom has here for decades though. She's a damn legend.
[]>crosscull:And you?

[]>angel:Did some speed, talked about stuff.
[]>capra:Yeah.
[]>angel:How are you feeling, by the way?
[]>capra:Fine enough.
[]>angel:I'm glad to hear.
[]>angel:Not much of note.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:It has just been a solid evening so far.
[]>crosscull:Good.
[]>narrator:Eventually, your train arrives, and you ride to almost the other side of town.
[]>narrator:After some deliberation, you decide to join them up. Maybe that can disstract from your parents.

[]>narrator:You enter the doorstep. You've bever been to this place and its filling you with unimaginable dread. <lc>But it's too late now. You are in a part of Helenia you do not recognize, and while the winter air is nice, it is also starting to hurt your lungs. <lc>You ring the doorbell. <lc>Shortly after, you are granted passage by the grating buzz of the unlocking mechanism.

[]>narrator:So far your christmas as been a desolate wasteland, just like all the years before. Your emotional landscape is at its most wind-scarred now, as you are completely lost, being thrust into sociality.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I don't wanna...
[]>narrator:But you have to. The door is open.
[]>narrator:You join up with Icy and Rider, and -<ap> more people than you imagined. <lc>Don't lose your nerves now.

[]>narrator:The three of you turn into the courtyard of an old building. <lc>This part of town is really outside of where you usually are. <lc>Graffiti lines almost every wall.
[]>crosscull:You've never been here?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:To where?
[]>narrator:Xe turns xer head up to one of the illuminated windows.
[]>crosscull:Rider's.
[]>capra:Can't say I have. It's only been like two weeks since I got to know you.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:Well, it'll be fun.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Hopefully...

[]>starry{starry-emotion|neutral}:CC and Angel responded, they're just now heading out.
[]>rider:Gonna have a full house over here. Damn.

[]>narrator:As you make your way inside, you are greeted with familiar faces.
[]>angel:Oh why hello, Capra! It's so nice seeing you again!

[]>narrator:When you return, you are greeted with some unfamiliar faces.
[]>angel:Hi! I dunno if we met before, I'm so lost always. But I'm Angel!
[]>capra:I don't think so. <lc>Hi.
[]>crosscull:Crosscull.
[]>capra:Hi.
[]>angel:And your name?
[]>capra:Uhh...<ap> Capra. Hi, again.

[]>narrator:As you make your way inside, you are greeted with some unfamiliar faces.
[]>angel:Hi! I dunno if we met before, I'm so lost always. But I'm Angel!
[]>capra:I don't think so. <lc>Hi.
[]>crosscull:Crosscull.
[]>capra:Hi.
[]>angel:And your name?
[]>capra:Uhh...<ap> Capra. Hi, again.
[]>narrator:A few minutes pass, and then the doorbell rings.

[]>angel:Hello everyone.
[]>crosscull:Hm.
[]>starry:Awesome you could make it!

[]>starry:This is so funny.
[]>narrator:They point at Crosscull and Angel.

[]>starry:You two came from Citrine and now Capra also joined us. The gayest Christmas party, for real.
[]>narrator:They didn't mean it as an insult, right?
[]>capra:...
[]>narrator:They might have...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...
[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:And now we're making it even better. Hehe.
[]>starry:So true bestie.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:We also brought Capra!
[]>starry{starry-emotion|neutral}:Hi Capra!
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Hi!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:....
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Hi...

[]>narrator:This is such an intimate setting. Four walls and five other people. <mp>It must have been years since you've been this involved.<lc>With greetings completed, the entire group is finally settling in.

45.page_key: angel and crosscull arrive at riders

content.content:
[]>icy-aloe:So how was the bar? I'm surprised you <func:bar_count> didn't stay longer.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|sad}:The music was just wasn't much of a vibe. I'm really sad about it because the DJs sounded really fun in the announcement posts.
[]>icy-aloe:The last one kinda fashy. <lc>Posted some genocide apologia earlier today and it went small-circle viral.
[]>crosscull:Okay.
[]>capra:How do you mean?
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|serious}:Just like everything this month, it boils down to... hatred and genocide. One of the DJs is a Phean apologist.
[]>narrator:That's the state genociding Leventians right now. <mp>Seems like the world is against them. <mp>Or at least all the powers that be.

[]>crosscull:Were there, too late now. <mp>Hate 'em.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:True. But enough of that. <ap>How was the concert?

[]>rider{rider-emotion|irritated,icy-aloe-emotion|neutral,starry-emotion|sad}:At least you got in.
[]>angel{angel-emotion|sad}:Excuse me?
[]>rider:It's the fucking Leventia thing. Bouncer said the scarf was terror symbol.
[]>crosscull:Hate.
[]>angel:Oh my god.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:That's such an extreme stance.
[]>starry:Not that uncommon though.

[]>angel:We just thought there wasn't much of an aftershow so you left early.
[]>rider:I wish.

[]>starry{starry-emotion|neutral}:Just last week I also had another run in.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I also had such a moment. It's always the conservatives going around my neighborhood.
[]>crosscull:Regrettably so.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:I hate how these types just talk at you. My dad does the same thing.
[]>starry{starry-emotion|sad}:Many such cases...

[]>capra:I came home after work recently and he was going around and stuff. <mp>I just... <mp> I dunno. <lc>Didn't even talk to the loser. <lc>I can stand doomscrolling but that's just too much for me.
[]>starry:Oh no Capra! Don't doomscroll!<lc>I do the same thing!
[]>rider{rider-emotion|neutral}:Oh no.
[]>starry:We gotta exchange brainrots at some point.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Uhh... <ap>Sure.

[]>icy-aloe:Gonna take a speedy rain check. Does anyone want to come with?
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:I think I'd rather rest here. <lc>Already had enough today.
[]>narrator:The others mirror the sentiment.

[]>narrator: Icy Aloe crouches down, and puts their phone on their lap, screen-up. From their pocket, they procure a small silicone bottle of disinfectant, and wipe the screen down. You watch with intent. They put the silicone bottle away again, and take out a small bag of white powder.
[]>icy-aloe: So you want some speed, right?

[]>capra:Does it feel good?
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|smug}:I think so.
[]>capra:Then yes.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:I already did some with Angel earlier. And I really like it so far, so yes, please.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Funnily enough, this isn't even my first time. That was with Angel about two hours ago.
[]>icy-aloe:First time speed?
[]>capra:Yes, what else...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:God no, not that.<lc>Yes, speed.
[]>icy-aloe:So would you like some more?

choices.choice_text.enabled: Yes, I'd like to join you.

content.content: []>capra{capra-emotion|content}: Sure.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:Oh I might have misunderstood then. I don't want any.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I already did with Angel, that was enough.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I'm good. <mp>I hope that's okay?

[]>narrator: Icy nods and looks down again. You also lower yourself, now both squatting against the door of the old house.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral,capra-emotion|neutral}: Hold this.
[]>narrator: She hands you the phone. You hold it steadily.<lc>She prepares a first line, and looks at you expectantly. <lc> You drag your nose across the phone, and the powder settles in your mucus membranes.
[]>capra: Thank you.
[]>icy-aloe: You're welcome.
[]>narrator:You hand them their phone back, and then she prepares her own line. Within seconds, it too, is gone.

[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral,capra-emotion|neutral}: It's a bit windy down here, could you cover this with your hands? 
[]>capra: Sure.
[]>narrator: You lower yourself down, cupping your hands around where Icy is working. Within controlled and minute motions, they have lay down a line and inhaled it.
[]>icy-aloe: Thanks for the wind cover.
[]>capra: You're welcome. I guess.

[]>narrator: You both get up again.
[]>icy-aloe: Is it okay if we chill out here for a bit still?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}: I mean, if the others are okay without us?
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|smug}: They are. Also, the weather is nice.
[]>narrator: It is.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}: It is.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>capra:...
[]>capra:...I like the night.
[]>icy-aloe: Me too. Aren't you a vampire as well?
[]>capra:...Only very newly, still.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}: Doesn't matter.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}: I guess.
[]>icy-aloe: It truly doesn't. Especially not to me. Most people don't even know I exist. I'm a silver vampire.
[]>capra: I'm- I'm sorry.
[]>icy-aloe: Huh?
[]>capra: I'm also not even sure what that means.
[]>icy-aloe: Eh, don't worry, it's not common knowledge. But yes. Vampirism is neither a monolith nor arbitrary. We just have an increased need for trace metals in our metabolism. And because evolution is a fuck, most vampires need extra iron, which is relative to other natural sources abundant in hemoglobin.

[]>capra: I should've explained it like that to my parents. Damn it.
[]>icy-aloe: Phobic parents?
[]>capra:All flavors of bigotry. <lc>My dad was a member of NSD for like 14 years. Never heard the end of how we need to protect our borders and... big-air-quotes-people... growing up.
[]>icy-aloe:Oh my... I am so deeply sorry, Capra.
[]>capra:It is what it is. You get used to it quickly. <ap>But please tell me more about you, I hate this.
[]>icy-aloe:Naturally.<lc>That there are different kinds of vampires is not even that common knowledge within our community. If you just stick to the very basic narrative of "we all need food, we vampires need different kinds" most people will get it. <lc> It will not stop bigots from being bigots though.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:When has that ever happened, anyways.
[]>icy-aloe:Sometimes you just have to introduce them to some high-priority 9mm delivery.
[]>capra:...Sure. <mp>Scary.
[]>icy-aloe:I can be. <mp>Speaking of, silver fangs really freak people out too. Are you comfortable with looking at people's teeth?
[]>capra:I don't have anything against it, really. Just kinda weird I guess.
[]>icy-aloe:Then check this out.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:I'm still really new to this, sorry.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:It's not even that common knowledge within our community.
[]>icy-aloe:As a silver vampire especially it's difficult to be visible.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...<mp> Hm?
[]>icy-aloe:Well...
[]>icy-aloe:Are you comfortable with looking at people's teeth?
[]>capra:I don't have anything against it, really. Just kinda weird I guess.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|smug}:Then check this out.

[]>narrator{icy-aloe-emotion|smug-silver}:Icy leans their head back, mouth wide agape.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Woah. That is freaky.
[]>narrator:Before you, and under the moonlight, ephemeral and bright metallic fangs superimpose themselves on Icy Aloe's canines.
[]>icy-aloe:Cool, are they not?
[]>capra:They are. <ap>They really are.
[]>capra{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Is that something all silver vampires have?
[]>icy-aloe:To differing degrees. But yes. <lc>If you're of the 98% iron vampires, you don't get lunarily-reactive enamel though, which is upsetting.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:And... how rare is this?
[]>icy-aloe:All non-iron vampires make up less than 2% of us. Silvers are about half a percent I believe. Documented cases within Doszbian make for an average argentum vampire every 150 years.
[]>capra:That's so long...
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|smug}:Special little snowflake!
[]>icy-aloe:Do you want to head back inside?

[]>narrator:The shift in topic quickly makes you realize that the speed is now hitting your system. Or has hit it a few minutes ago.<lc>After presumably a few seconds, Icy inquires.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|neutral}:Capra. How are you doing?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:Hehe. Just had my system reboot a bit.
[]>icy-aloe:So that's good?
[]>capra:It feels nice. Thank you.
[]>icy-aloe:With pleasure. <mp>Now let us get back in before we freeze.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:I don't know.
[]>icy-aloe:It's getting cold out. Let's go.
[]>capra:Alright.
[]>icy-aloe:They open the door and close it behind you.

[]>capra:I dont wanna be outside right now. I'm sorry.
[]>icy-aloe{icy-aloe-emotion|smug}:Alright, see you soon-soon.
[]>narrator:You hear the door click, and are unsure what soon-soon means.

[]>angel{angel-emotion|happy}:I gotta say, Starry, I find your fang progression quite beautiful.
[]>starry{starry-emotion|neutral}:Oh my god, thank you.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Hey, Starry. I hope you don't mind.
[]>starry{starry-emotion|sad}:Mind what?
[]>capra:I'm curious. What's with your fangs?
[]>starry{starry-emotion|neutral}: Oh yeah. That's just how they are.
[]>capra: That's weird.
[]>starry:It is. <mp>And no one knows how they got like this. Microplastics, maybe.
[]>capra:But would you say they feel any different?
[]>starry:I don't have a point of comparison. But I could bite into circuitry and get- <ap> like a rush from it. And I know that's not normal.
[]>rider: If you chew up my GPU I'll kill you.
[]>starry: I *could*, <ap>Rider, <ap>do you listen to me? I've only heard of it from others, I've never tried it myself.
[]>angel: That's so cool.
[]>starry: But not very useful.
[]>capra:Is that also why all of your mirrors have shutters on them?
[]>starry: They kinda give me headache. It's also because of the glitch stuff. No other vamps I know have that sensation.
[]>angel:Yep.
[]>starry: They're kinda like- <ap> the digital age lives in me, you know? When my parents came here, we had pretty much nothing. And now I'm a sysadmin and it's like modern technology runs through my blood.

[]>capra:So do you have- <ap>Donors?
[]>starry:Well, yea.
[]>capra:Interesting...
[]>angel{angel-emotion|neutral}:I think she means with regards to the glitches themself?
[]>starry:Oh yes. <mp>It seems they don't affect others, really.

[]>starry: So yes, while I don't have control over this, it still... gives me like a plug into what runs this shit-backwards society.
[]>rider:But you're still not using it to dismantle it.
[]>starry:"Queer, second-gen immigrant vampire destroys company property" is not a headline that helps with living.

[/center]<lc>[center](They were always in the way.)[/center]<lc>[center]And when your sleep deprived mother opens the door, you politely ask her to give you a glass of water.[/center]<lc>[center]You ask if your father was woken up by you.[/center]<lc>[center]She does not know.[/center]<lc>[center](They've lived separate lives in separate rooms for years.)[/center]<lc>[center]You do not get the information you desire. She was never reliable. She hands you a glass of water. [/center]<lc>[center]You drink it.[/center]<lc>[center]Blood runs through your eyes, you see the world die in a grand pit-black soulless fire.[/center]<lc>[center]Then you grab the knife and stab it in her throat.[/center]<lc>[center]She tries to wrestle you.[/center]<lc>[center]She succeeds.[/center]<lc>[center]She bleeds out from the open wound in her neck.[/center]<lc>[center]The sounds are horrifying.[/center]<lc>[center]She is not dead.[/center]<lc>[center]Her body still twitches. And she looks up at you with horror-filled eyes.[/center]<lc>[center]You gouge them out.[/center]<lc>[center]You stab her in the face. Repeatedly. Over and over. Until your mother becomes unrecognizable from the flesh you have seen inside your thigs.[/center]<lc>[center]You never showed her those scars.[/center]<lc>[center]She bleeds more.[/center]<lc>[center]She expells her bladder and intenstines and you step over the disgusting pile of shit and piss and blood and entrails.[/center]<lc>[center]You sneak into your father's room.[/center]<lc>[center]He's asleep.[/center]<lc>[center]You slash his throat.[/center]<lc>[center]In some nights (you know which ones) you wish you could do those things to him. [/center]<lc>[center]Or that he'd kill you outright. [/center]<lc>[center]And splash of blood that ends in your mouth gets spit back out.[/center]<lc>[center]And now -<ap>Now he's no more.[/center]<lc>[center]Your parents are no more.[/center]<lc>[center]You.[/center]<lc>[center]You- <ap>are no more.[/center]
[]>narrator:The morning is about to break and the texture of everything has changed. <lc>And so you walk on unsteady legs, with an eternal scar on your soul.

[]>metaspirit:Capra. <mp>What are you doing here.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:Doing what I maybe should have done a long time ago. I just did not realize.
[]>metaspirit:You plan to kill your parents?
[]>capra:I do.
[]>metaspirit:Then let me just tell you this. There is a third third type of blackness, unbound from the cosmic lattice: <ap>Shades. <mp> They exist as echoes of others. Of vampires that kill and stalk. Often those without community.

[]>capra:I have others now, though.
[]>metaspirit:And you think they would let you back in after such a deed?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...<lc>Maybe not.

[]>metaspirit:Vampires that kill become shades when they die. Your soul will forever be trapped in the underbelly of the lattice. Not alone in the void, not within the abyss.<lc>At the dusk of your death, an existence between existences will become your new eternity. <mp>Is that what you want?

choices.choice_text.enabled: Go through with it. Kill your parents.
Run into the forest. Let out your rage there.

content.content:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:Okay...<ap> listen up. Please.
[]>metaspirit: You nailed me down into this form willingly just now...
[]>capra: I've made up my mind. If I want to live without a constant cloud over my head, they have to go. I don't want to waste my prime adulthood waiting for it.
[]>metaspirit:Then, feel your heartbeat echo the cosmos. Draw upon it, and find the strength that resonates with you.

[]>narrator:You focus inward, on your hearbeat. <lc> And then a great nothingness cloaks your conscious. <lc>Their screams are never at the forefront of your mind. <ap>Neither is your bodily health. <mp>You feel your form contort and writhe, as you draw out an eldritch mass of choking mist, filling the entire apartment. <lc> Your heart beats faster.<lc>Your materialize the mist into choking chains and instruments of impalement, perforating and constricting your parents' bodies and souls.<lc>Your heart beats even faster.<lc>Iron vampire with onyx blood, this is what you are capable of. <mp>And now be expelled from the lattice.<lc>And then, it is done. Dissociated to hell and back, you leave through the stairwell, down from the apartment. <lc>There is a boulder of obsidian on your shoulders and a drowning tar on your mind. <mp>You almost collapse. <mp>Your arms feel like they have been ripped in two.
[]>narrator:You walk home.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:You coerced me to this
[]>metaspirit: ...
[]>capra: You did. <lc> You gave me... power.
[]>metaspirit: I did not. If you think this way, I apologize. But Your hatred is entirely within yourself. Instead of lifting up your community, you found it more valuable to tear down those that could've never antagonized or benefitted you.
[]>metaspirit: This feeling of regret.
[]>capra: ...
[]>metaspirit: Familiar to you.
[]>narrator: You nod.
[]>metaspirit: That is the shade entering your body.
[]>capra:I did not think I could. <ap>Snuff them out. I mean I- <ap>I knew but.
[]>metaspirit:When you die, your soul will become a haunting and starved ghoul. 
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:So be it, then.<lc>I'm so sorry.
[]>capra:I do not regret what I did.

[]>capra: It's as icy said. You have to protect your community.
[]>metaspirit: Would they have posed an actual threat?
[]>capra: I don't know.
[]>metaspirit:Was this correct?
[]>capra:I don't feel like futurelooking right now. <lc>But I'll always have their past abuse to look back on.

[]>capra:What's done is done.
[]>metaspirit:Now that you've thrown your soul away...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Until then I will be free.
[]>capra:I'll never find out. But now I'm free.
[]>narrator:You walk home.

[]>narrator:The pale winter sun illuminates the early noon sky as you awake. Afterimages from a dream of burning churches still linger in your mental vision.<lc>Could the rooftop from which to see such a view exist? You do not know.<lc>Perhaps in time, you and your newfound kin will build a grand temple atop these ruins.
[]>metaspirit:The silver winter sun is a powerful one. <lc>You have found a first home within community. <lc>And you all will build something grand atop these ashes.
[]>narrator:Institutions continue crumbling in your vision of the end, and the birth of a new world. <lc>Churchburner Capra.

[]>narrator:Pleasantly enough, the way home by foot, according to your phone, leads you through a lonely bit of forest along the city outskirts. The soundscape of a small rivulet flowing nearby and nocturnal critters accompanies you on your journey.
[]>narrator:The evening with those two might have been pleasant. But nothing beats a lonely walk in the forest.

[]>narrator:And so, the arboreal emptiness claims you. You wander through the nightly forest, with the partially still-cloudy sky overhead robbing you of some vision distance. <lc>You give your inner monologue a voice.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Overall, I must say... This isn't too bad, right now. <lc>I've had worse days.
[]>capra:Hey Spirit, can you even see this scenery?

[]>metaspirit:You are not out of the woods yet.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Isn't that what makes up a forest in the first place?  
[]>metaspirit:I meant it metaphorically.
[]>capra:...
[]>metaspirit:...
[]>capra:Was that pun intentional?
[]>metaspirit:...<lc>No.
[]>metaspirit:It is quite beautiful.

[]>narrator{capra-emotion|spiraling}:You are so lonely and pathetic.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:...<lc>I know.
[]>narrator:You were this close, THIS CLOSE, to hanging out with more people. Instead you prefer to rot at home, or amongst trees as dead as you.
[]>narrator:Your parents raised a failure- <ap>Molded a failure by way of abuse. Go and kill them.

[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:You may be wondering...
[]>narrator:Stop talking to yourself. This will be a bad place to go.
[]>capra:What is it even that makes me hate them so much?
[]>narrator:Cease.
[]>capra:Just one quick spiral.
[]>narrator:This will be horrible.
[]>capra:I'm really curious though!
[]>capra:Well?<lc>...<lc>...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|anger}:WELL?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:It's easy...
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:Because my parents are bad people.
[]>narrator:...
[]>capra:Ever- <ap>Ever heard of csa? <mp>They don't know shit about my psyche because I learned to shut them out of my active consciousness when I was 10. <mp>They don't know I'm trans because- <ap> because they are not worth the breath to explain it to them. <mp>He wants trans people dead. <ap>I'm over it. <mp>Without knowing it, my dad has told me he wants me dead.

choices.choice_text.enabled: Kill them. You are a powerful and eldritch being.
Kill them. They exist to hate. Such an existence is unworthy.

content.content:
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:Ugh....
[]>narrator:This is all too much for you. <lc>You should vomit. <lc>Purge, Capra.
[]>capra:I went past that- <ap> I-
[]>narrator:Still <ap>too <ap>much.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:I know... <ap>There's...<ap>AAAAAAAAA.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|sad}:I just want to go home.
[]>narrator:And so you do. <mp>The entire walk home is a blur.

[]>narrator:You walk.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:This is... <lc>How did I end up here...
[]>narrator:You have to get further away.
[]>capra:I'm still here?
[]>narrator:You have to get further away from yourself.
[]>capra:Maybe not for long.
[]>narrator:Even further. Run.
[]>narrator:Sprint. Dash. Barrel.
[]>narrator:Shred through the thicket of the forest until your vision gives out.
[]>capra:What...
[]>narrator:And then keep going.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:What am I doing here?
[]>narrator:An attempt at escape.
[]>capra:AAAAAAAAAAAAAA

[]>narrator:And then you break into a forest clearing. <mp>A scenery unfamiliar to you, it piques your curiosity.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:Huh... <lc>This is... <lc>I'd say this is really pretty.
[]>narrator:As you wade through the glade between the pines, the moon shines overhead, and the rustling of leaves caresses your ears and soul. <lc>Chained down by the weight of your conscience, you gaze up at your lunar lover and wish for the world to take flight towards that space of dead rock and dead dreams. <lc>And then, a vision of the end, of the moon crumbling and falling out of the sky, blots out your fantasy, and you are forced into the soil. <mp>Kneeling and exhausted, you let this wake of negativity wash over you. <mp>And then finally, you are home.

62.page_key: run deeper itnto forest to avoid killing parents

content.content:
[]>narrator:Finally home, after the entire ordeal with your parents, you sink into your couch.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|hung-over}:This is still so awful. This is nothing worthwhile.
[]>narrator:Home at last, you are absolutely void of affection for the world. <lc>Like every single day, it is leaving you alone, to rot evermore.

[]>narrator:To get the last hours of night over with, there is only one remedy: One last drink.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|drunk}:This is becoming my holiday tradition, <ap>and work week tradition-<ap> now.

[]>narrator:Things may be looking up.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|content}:It's actually been quite a while since I last consumed... anything.
[]>narrator:At the end of everything, you will always have drugs.
[]>narrator:You are clean- <lc>And even if the entire world is crumbling around you, that inner sanctum is now within you.
[]>narrator:And so, with the violent sleep claiming you once more, the inner voice cries out one last time.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:I'm empty. <lc>There's nothing worth anything in my god-damn useless shit life.
[]>narrator:With the nonhuman aura of the forest floor, you become one.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:IF I'M DESTINED TO DIE ALONE, <ap>THEN WHY DOESN'T THE UNIVERSE JUST <ap>TAKE ME AWAY HERE AND NOW? <ap>WHY DO I HAVE TO SUFFER ALONE INSIDE MY HEAD?

[]>capra:I see the world from outside my head.<lc>Because everyone knows I can't see it in a god damn mirror.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|spiraling}:I'm in over my head with this.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:Metaspirit. <ap>What... <ap>Did you do to me?
[]>metaspirit:[center]I embraced your doom.[/center]
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:I WISH- <ap>I WISH YOU'D HAVE FUCKING- <ap>KILLED ME INSTEAD!
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:AND WHY- <ap> AND PLEASE TELL ME WHY- <ap>DOES THIS FEEL LIKE EVERY <ap>OTHER<ap> DAMN <ap>DAY <ap>OF <ap>MY <ap>LIFE THEN?
[]>capra{capra-emotion|crying}:I WILL FIND A WAY TO <ap>KILL <ap>THE <ap>BOTH <ap>OF <ap>US, EVEN IF IT TAKES MY SOUL ACROSS THE COSMOS- <ap>OR MY BRAINS ACROSS THE PAVEMENT!
[]>metaspirit:Vampires that hate become shades. empty and longing eternally. Yearning without reprieve. You knew this, and yet, you struck.
[]>capra{capra-emotion|neutral}:Because this is the only chance of how I might experience peace.<lc>There will be nothing to fear in this life.
[]>narrator:With a deep and gossamer veil embracing the core of your heart, you lay yourself to rest. <lc>In the morning, you will wake up to nothing but tragedy.
[]>narrator:Capra, Shade born of Hate.
